qdhcnsidWmlJsvtoVVr5Kw.text: The food is decent here unless you come when it's busy, then you'll be lucky to get a steak cooked the way you would like. We typically sit at the bar and get good service however Jenn H. Doesn't seem to know what good service is. She always seems to be one some type of drug from the night before and is rather combative. It confuses me being in the service industry myself that the manager Gene doesn't take the precautionary measures to make sure this doesn't happen. Seems to me that they want this to be a "Boys club" and everything else is tolerated if you look good in their tank top. Any who won't be taking my business there any longer and you shouldn't either.

GSR6Di2OVIKX-Py6kO_NhQ.text: After finishing four hour hike at Red Canyon we decided to pop in for quick lunch.  Little did we know that an hour later we are still sitting here without any food.  The waitress not only screws up our original sandwich order we waited 30 minutes for and mind you there is NO OTHER person eating at this time. Another thirty minutes go by and we just ask for the check only to have them charge us for the food we have yet to see.  So not only we are still hungry we also are being bothered by drunk low life 50 something woman singing to the entertainment live show.   How they stay in business is amazing....

5E45BtlzRRH4ReI8CEZCuw.text: This was my second visit and both were extremely pleasant. I love our server, Taylor...she's amazing. My only complaint was the hostess. She didn't seem very pleasant when we first arrived. She gave us as irritated look as she was chewing her gum like a horse. As we were leaving, she was squatting down behind the host area texting on her phone. She was very unprofessional. Other than that, service was great, food was amazing and atmosphere was chill.

F6r_H04NJXkc9ptFkEF7Mw.text: Wow! Great food! And great service!!!! Taylor and heather!!! Love these girls!!! This night was my first night over here. I usually go to other places in the area but that's over. I found a new food\drink home!!!! Can't Waite to try the rest of the menu!

TO6JJhox_OJeSCEnAFlGsg.text: Mother's Day was the first time I had eaten there. The fillets were cooked perfectly and were delicious, as was the lobster tail. One person had the Chicken Marsala and it too was excellent. And if you are a Mac and Cheese fan you have to try theirs, so good.  Service was friendly and efficient. Am looking forward to going back and bringing my family.

FL8ICEUIR6Gz0jF_GJk0pw.text: We decided to stop by here for lunch after hiking out at Red Rocks Canyon.  We ordered an appetizer of the BBQ Wings. They came with fries, carrots and celery. This was the highlight of the meal. The fries were cooked well, seasoned perfectly, and the wings still had some crunch, and the sauce wasn't over done.   I ordered the Ranch Chicken Sandwich and requested a change of the breaded chicken to grilled, which they accommodated just fine, but the chicken wasn't in one piece.  It was two thin pieces of chicken stacked on top each other, and the one piece was actually two or three laid together. I needed to keep the toothpick in the bun just to keep the sandwich together to try to eat it. Eventually, I gave up on the bun and just started cutting the chicken with a knife and ate it with a fork.  I chose the salad for the side, since we already had fries with our app. I asked for ranch instead of the champagne vinaigrette because I was unsure if it would be too much, but the cooks made it the same as usual out of habit. The salad was overwhelmingly coated in the dressing, and they loaded it with so much feta cheese that the flavor was too much to handle. I would have preferred the spring mix with ranch and nothing else compared to the overloaded and overdone salad that I got. I also noticed that I wasn't the only person that the cooks didn't pay attention to because another patron of the restaurant had to send their side back because they had asked for something else.  The server we had (it said Blondie on the receipt) was excellent. Friendly and cheerful, despite feeling overwhelmed from being the only server in the restaurant.    The bartender, Renee, on the other hand, should be fired. She had an attitude on the floor and was cursing a lot. I don't care what kind of day you have had, it's inappropriate to act that way while working. You shouldn't be cursing about the guests either, even if they are people you know. (One example is, "...get these f*@^ers some fries.") Totally inappropriate and unprofessional. She needs a hard dose of reality on how to act in public.

NBfQxvL5SAJudSQPARgMpA.text: The general manager has chased off almost all of the good servers / women that have worked here for years!!.... The fun has left the building... too bad!!   It is only a few days until Downtown Summerlin gives us a ton of choices!!!

8I8m5v7FtOa0t7LpEb929g.text: The food is so good here! We came in late night and enjoyed the ribs, baked potato, Mac n cheese and philly fries... A half order is a heaving pile of goodness that will fill up a whole table of four! It's such a big portion and it was 1/2 off too!! They have a lot of great specials and I can't wait to go back to try more food!!

jwcVTKBfHrGrVTvuzI7Elw.text: Great local bar with excellent drinks and food .  Their Sunday 2 for 1 steak special is awesome .  We went with my family today and ordered  a burger plain after explaining that my son was allergic to dairy . To my absolute dismay they served the burger twice ,  again and when we mentioned it still had cheese I watched them scrape off the cheese and put it back on the grill .  Absolutely unacceptable and will not go back there again .  They arbitrarily took it in their own hands to jeopardize my son health .  The GM expressed his concern and the waitress comped the other meals . Nice gesture but cannot take a chance on them again .  It's a shame as we have been going there since the grand opening .  I don't make a habit of writing reviews but for all the people who suffer from food allergies just be aware of their practices .

3Kf1hSC82b2bgG7WhQPhdA.text: Two trips here in a week, and I will be back for more.  Good beer, good atmosphere, decent food, and fantastic servers make for a great time, especially when it sits across the street from my house!    First time was with my relative, who was staying at the Red Rock but wanted to see the house so we decided to cross the street and have a couple of beers.  On a Wednesday night they were pretty busy, and despite only wanting to drink and not eat, they were more than happy to have us.  Our server, Elizabeth, was super sweet and super cute.  The beer aren't great bargains ($5/$8 for a typical 12/24oz bottles), but it does get a bit less expensive during happy hour (4-6pm).  Last night, my friends and I decided to head over for some food and drinks, and despite being full and having to find a table for 8, they were very pleasant and speedy.  We ordered a bunch of  Philly Fries and Nachos, with the former being great and the latter pretty good.  Liked the fact that the nachos had real steaks though.  I'd like to try the rest of the menu eventually.  The server (never got her name) was again very awesome, and they are the real reasons I like coming here.  Experience never goes sour when service is great!  Table-for-1 Factor:  It's a bar & grill and they have a large bar area, so I can see myself parking here alone on those nights when I need to catch a game.

k8NG6Lcs7CePKJTS-ZVvXA.text: Stopped here for lunch after a morning at the local range. The half prices steaks on Sunday are awesome and the service was decent as well. We will be back.

--niC2skIV0PLHPqyz3wFQ.text: How can you discontinue your $6 burgers??? One local spot that is losing their charm.

LIelU1HJll6PWSkewZY3ZQ.text: It's been at least a year or two since I've been here. Used to live nearby. This place has gone downhill...  ATMOSPHERE: It used to be a quaint little place to grab a nice bite to eat in a quiet, relaxed, upscale place. It's gotten really tacky since my last visit. Cheesy decorations everywhere. Terrible hip hop music (which none of the 7 customers seemed to be enjoying). The menu looks like a drunk scrapbooker made it...it used to look a lot more professional. The back page of the menu is dedicated to the "John Cutter Girls", full of pictures of what appears to be the all-female staff in John Cutter tank tops. When I said tacky, I wasn't kidding (and I'm a male in my thirties...I'm pretty sure I'm the clientele they're targeting and it was tacky to me). I think maybe the owner of this place is a middle aged, horny guy with no taste. If not, then maybe they're targeting middle aged, horny guys with no taste for customers.  FOOD: The food was still pretty good. I ordered the BBQ Chicken Flatbread, one of my old favorites. It still tastes great but it's a pizza now, not a flatbread. They should change their menu to reflect that. I probably wouldn't have ordered nachos if I knew the it was a pizza. The nachos were just ok, really sparse toppings.   I used to think this place was great. I talked it up to my girlfriend before we went. What a letdown. I doubt I'll go back. If this place were to lose the tackiness and go back to being a little more upscale and slick, I think it would be better off. Oh yeah, and I'm pretty sure the bartender was drunk, which just added to the tackiness of the place.

ASBmWQ4sLv_A1YUZnNmeHw.text: For a convenient, neighborhood restaurant they need to have better food. The servers are friendly, the location is good but their food product is below average.  Dinner tonight: two uninteresting wrap sandwiches overloaded with lettuce and a Chinese chicken salad that was a pile of iceberg lettuce with a vague hint of some dressing, canned mandarin oranges and some cold dry grilled chicken breast. That's not a Chinese chicken salad.  You need a better chef to design a menu that's great; simple, tasty food prepared correctly and served well. That makes a neighborhood restaurant succeed, otherwise just be a bar.

VCD7cuS38IdeYuj-3Prhqw.text: I've only been here a handful of times and I ordered the same dish every time BUT I enjoyed it. I have a toddler so I appreciate that they have a kid's menu, my picky eater actually ate her meal and it's really exciting for her that the kids meal comes with a dessert, and they'll pack it to go if your little one is too full to dig in right after the meal. Prices are reasonable, or at least I think.   The chocolate mint stick things they have at the door are so good, i selfishly get a little greedy with them especially since my daughter likes them too...I mean, I will clean them out.   One negative is the food takes a little long to come out. So maybe, just don't go if you're starving or close to it.

27-YAnImV3tdiL2GGzS5kA.text: Went for dinner the other night. Over-all table response was 3 stars.  Everybody who ordered steak or a burger loved it! Super flavorful, tasted really fresh, cooked perfectly. Oddly, anything that was not beef was not very good. Pasta was blah. The lobster was gummy and obviously pre-frozen, it tasted like it was defrosted under running water. yuck!  The decor is cool and rustic. The service was really great.   If you go, stick to what they do best.  Meat!

G1c2OKuo7aT2KD-H9RHhvQ.text: This place is just average. It's a bit pricey and the food isn't super flavorful. I had the salmon and it didn't have any flavor and the asparagus was hard and crispy. No seasoning on any of it. The philly fries look good but yet again are lacking flavor. Service was good once the owner sat outside where we were. Before that it was a bit slow. The person that I went with ordered the Cajun chicken pasta. That was good but you have to order it with extra sauce or else it comes dry. We might come back to try a steak special...those don't include anything other then the meat though. Best thing about the place is the location!

7yAfTPJZMPQJ5LmAiFZ23g.text: Sunday steak is the best half off. Our favorite is bone in rib eye. Add mushroom and or grilled onions for less than a buck each. Side salad is superb as well.  My hubby and I always split it and the tomatoes are always sweet and I don't like tomatoes. Service is always wonderful. Thanks Ladies.

Pfxip5BDlaK2vEXsTjjuMA.text: Server "J" she was very friendly and customer service oriented. Mac N' Cheese was to die for. Burgers were also amazing great as well.

FaVUALn-_InGBeGloALAXA.text: No...  No...  Just no.  This is close to my house and was so bad I won't go back. Terrible service. Food so so....  Totally jack you around with fake specials..  And didn't honor face value of Groupon...  Which Groupon ended up refunding. BAD BUSINESS INTEGRETY

l8BNC27NQRpZdiJMWSom6Q.text: Our first time eating here and we happened upon 1/2 off burger Tuesday. The 10oz. Sandwich was excellent, perfectly cooked to Midrare, we chose the house salad as a side and it was surprising: nice greens, multi-colored grape tomatoes, feta, and PINE NUTS!! on a house side salad, yum! Our service was excellent as well (Tatay) We're coming back to try the weekend breakfast!

VOe4X6nIZj5ZOnzV0O4nRQ.text: The Philly cheese fries here are really good. I was impressed that a local style bar had a specialty drink menu. The margarita on there was unique and pretty tasty. The only let down was that there was no beer on tap. Having some beers on tap is a must for a bar.

SBPj0MCQCZz6JhP5x3JC7w.text: Sunday Night 1/2 price steaks, Heather our waitress is the bomb.  Best steak in area.  The old world charm of the wooden rafters made for a great meal, my 3rd trip to vegas this year John Cutters 3rd time too. Love everything.

s8S58n3J-ctHixTzkJx5Iw.text: JC is so disappointing! Just made my 4th (and last) visit in the last year since I moved to the Paseos. Forget about coming here if you're a woman, the 2 meals I've eaten alone here were the worst. Service sucks in general however I noticed a few of the single men that came in were greeted with giggles and hugs - they sat at the bar. Inside is small, dark and tables are crowded together.  Food is mediocre. Best meal we've had was the Philly cheesesteak; worst was the French toast.  Side note: Every weekend this shopping center is full of people busy in recreational activities, wish we had a healthy, open airy cafe to reflect that!

EY2wqb1LKDtJfUMIs7iwqQ.text: Great Mexican food-- shocking coming from a bar. Nice outside patio and good selection of cold beers.

N18sSW9KhEROTnvDIqDhpw.text: Was not impressed with the service or the food. Ordered their signature burger, was not impressed. Service left much to be desired. Was helped about equally by the chef compared to the waiter(bartender). It wasn't busy. Not much room for excuse of why the service lacked.  Was served a glass with my first beer but not my second. Neither of my beers were apparently classified for happy hour. One was a 12oz bottle and the other was a 12oz can. Thought at least the bottle counted but regardless. Subpar service and food quality for a place masquerading their quality. Based on the owners responses on other reviews I'm honestly not surprised and expect nothing but backlash for this review. That's ok!

0sdQjPUGQiR1Tc63sPxUbw.text: So...we gave John Cutter the benefit of the doubt and came twice.  First night we ordered the filet(medium) and it was pretty much cold!  Very rare to say the least.  We asked for it to be put back on grill for a bit and really didn't even get an apology from the waitress.  Two nights later we came with friends and tried again.  Ordered steak same way and the steak was wayyyy overdone and didn't taste remotely fresh.  I again told waitress~ to not be acknowledged again!  To me this is terrible customer service!  I didn't expect a free meal but an apology or something from a manager would have been nice, or maybe offer to get us a desert or better yet a GOOD steak!  If it were not for their amazing Mac and Cheese I can't say I would even give John Cutters a one star!   Noisy Overpriced  Bad customer service Inconsistent steaks Drinks are FULL of ice~maybe three sips of Moscow mule (for $11!) Not sure when we will be back...

pZQwTsKJAH8eGyfmXIujTA.text: Me and friends love coming on Sunday for their 1/2 priced steaks! The steak is sooo good. Cool environment. Nice service. Just overall a really great place!

8Akj8YyQ9XN7AoGhv8Z0nQ.text: Update:  We has Sarah as our waitress and she was Great.  We also enjoy the philly chicken, Caesar salad and potato skins.    Well.... We had high hopes.  The service was good, however, the Happy Hour wasn't as reasonable as many other places (like Brio/Kona/Bonefish, etc). Drinks were pricey. 5 of the people in our party did not like their food. I enjoyed mine. We all thought it was over priced for the type of food.  The philly steak sandwich wasn't good :(. Not sure why they put so much yellow cheese (instead of provolone, etc) and way too much cheese.   Anyway, I might try this place again since it's close to our house.  I'll review / update after then.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States

usqe54SlFGi6Ru4ZzXdGhg.text: Great neighborhood spot. Food overall is pretty good. I was actually impressed with the Cobb salad. My only gripe is that the wings are like 9 or 10 wings for $15. I like wings but $1.50 per is kinda high for standard bar wings. Their staff has always been friendly.   The breakfast ain't bad either.

nV9_47ji0j9MnMdOmYtosw.text: Good Saturday at JC's. Did the salmon, wings and fruit and my new favorite tuna chips. Gaming and drinks are always spot on. Great local spot in Summerlin we always enjoy coming in has a very welcoming feeling.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cockroach that&#39;s 100% what that is. Philly cheese, egg and cockroach.

jqrt_72l157-MkTTXJzU4w.text: My boyfriend and I have been here before and the food was good. Today would've been my second time but my boyfriend and I walked out for the service we weren't given for a good 10-15 minutes. I KNOW they saw us because we made eye contact but it was if they didn't want to help us. We tried to get their attention, but it was as if they kept choosing to ignore us. The least they could have done is acknowledge us to let us know that they will be with us in a moment or ask us if we've been helped. The people behind us even left because the servers were unattentive. My boyfriend and I ended up going to Lazy Dog down the street.

ECyZcWgmgIx_tB6rzsna2Q.text: If you love steak like I do, you have to come here! Especially on Sundays when the steaks are 1/2 price. I like the rib eye cut , medium rare, it's juicy and oh so flavorful. I've actually never eaten anything else on the menu. The service is good most of the time and I really like the dark, warm atmosphere.

4HUF7NhHK4yxXhfqyKh6lg.text: My mom and I came in to try this place out for lunch today and I liked our server, Alex! She has a very genuine smile and she was very helpful! 5/5 stars for her service!  I would say this is a good place for a night out with friends to eat some good food and drink. I thought the food was pretty good but it is definitely food for a night out. 4/5 stars

Ut893giKmkpZPeoEtmUfMQ.text: Walked in at about 2:30 on a Sunday. I wasn't busy but there were some senior patrons sitting up the slots at the bar and having some drinks. It was seat yourself so I did so and was waited on promptly. My waitress was courteous and there was no issue. I ordered the carne asada flour tacos with rice and beans, and the whole order came out unusually dry. The cheese on the tacos was already cooled and the meat was hard and dry with no seasoning. The rice and beans were the same...there was a shell of hard crunchy rice, and part of the refried beans were so dried out it crumbled. I don't know if it was all overcooked, sat under a heat lamp, or just sat there too long before it was brought out. Service good, atmosphere good, food was only palatable after I doused all of it in salsa and lime.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The side of beans that came out. They were so dried out part of them crumbled.
Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos came out and had no flavor. The meat was dried and hard...the cheese already cooled and hard.
Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A whole plate of rice and beans. Both were dried out.

mznSyg2jvgyF8HgGyG9HsQ.text: I dont understand why people give em bad reviews for the service. I guess because of the price you pay you feel entitled to be treated as royal. Prices are not cheap i recomend you try it with their weekend specials. Buy one steak get one free, sides not inclued. Besides having really generous portions. Food quality is outstanding. Not a divey place, not applebees. But still a very familiar/friendly atmosphere. The only downfall was some little cleaning details. There was a piece of red cabagge in our table. And in the restroom wet paper towels in the sink. Those little details got me thinking.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vryCz6NDOG_bJ9XdeCepIA.text: Love this restaurant.  Great location in summerlin. Open 24 hours so I can have  Anything on the menu any time during the day which is fabulous. Sunday steaks are half price. The fillet & rib eye are always done to perfection.   Large portions and if you can manage the chocolate cake for dessert is delicious. Friendly wait staff And perfect cocktails!

40myJiKGq8XkXV6v7wKCWA.text: Nachos were delicious. First burger was well done (ordered medium). Sent it back and the next one was very rare. Kids pizza was gross. Service was slow. Second time we came. First time we were here it was a much better experience.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw burger!!!   (ordered medium!). Gross!

FduOvljtvtleMjjmfYV8_Q.text: Waited an hour to get out food. Tacos were so hot/spicy we needed a pitches of water to eat it. Waitress not paying attention to customers. Food wasnt all that.

ATE6mD56P5qcq6wmaqjVfQ.text: John Cutter's is my favorite neighborhood tavern. The menu is delicious and has portions that could feed two people. The staff is friendly to everyone and take pride in their service.  Sunday's are the best when their steaks are half off.

4HF8R2n7HQO8py3FXz0yjw.text: After finding out about their loyalty club online, I had to stop in & join! I've known about this place for quite some time and never made it here. It is a bit off the beaten path unless your path takes you deep into Summerlin.   The loyalty club includes gaming promos and a birthday freebie, so count me in! After the bartender signed me up, she told me $10 play would be available right away after earning 20 points. They have a sign above the bar to join their text club, and I did, getting an offer for $20 match play. I was informed that offer was the same as the $10 for earning 20 points. She told me she would put $10 on my card for next time. I shall return! It would be nice to get both offers cause it's confusing as to if they are one and the same offer..........?????  It's a small place with one big room for dining and gaming/drinking etc. at the bar. Must be nonsmoking, I believe. Outside seating is also available. The menu has many different apps, meals, etc. to choose from and they have a Sunday steak special for 50% off steaks.

SfW3XSsq9uBWgryxmtVS2Q.text: Just having a working lunch with my hubby at John Cutter, great service and the food is incredibly delicious.  Try the dynamite rolls and the Philly fries Ask for Samantha, she's an excellent server!

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hPF5DdN7GwgaGuTgzdR7vg.text: My husband and I had a really nice experience tonight. Service was great, fast and food was delicious and big portions. I ordered JC salad with no added meat and hubby got 1/2 portion of Philly cheese steak. Oh my, we could barely finish. We left happy

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 portion Philly cheese steak. $8. Can&#39;t imagine a full portion. This was already huge
Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. JC salad $8

sJkrmTMrlhu290u_PzuUvw.text: Dropped by on Sunday after the hike so I could catch the Panthers vs Seahawks game. At the time it was already 24-0 Carolina (sorry Roger) so I decided to order a Bloody Mary and bacon, eggs, toast breakfast ($8) and watch the end of the first half before heading home.  Sundays are 1/2 off on Steaks. So the Ribeye which normally goes for $35 is $17...that's a good deal. Unfortunately the special didn't apply to the steak and eggs breakfast.   Place is a bit dark, but it is non-smoking for those that care. They have gaming at the bar. I've been here probably a dozen times over the years. They have several 4 top tables, and booths, and a few larger tables that can seat 8-10 so ok for groups.   Breakfast was good, nothing too exciting. Only 2 strips of bacon :(   Bloody Mary was tasty and hit the spot perfectly. Service was good. It wasn't too busy which surprised me.   Closest bar to Red Rock Canyon.

xLeQ3PtZyUDOr_pbZOVTsg.text: My first trip out to this restaurant id give it a 5/5. Second trip back... not so much.  We were told there was an hour wait for our food because there was a mix up in the schedule and they were short manned. I get it, mistakes happen. The wait was definitely long, but the food that came out came out warm. Their steak fries were legit. Definitely something everyone should try. Their surf and turf was delicious as well, easily a 4/5 meal. I didnt expect their shrimp/fish tacos to be spicey... but it was. Delicious but too hot for me. We had to ask for more plates and eating utensils several times.   I was hoping we would get comp'd with something. We did have a table of 10 and ordered a good amount. It wouldve be nice to get some free drinks. Just sayin.

srEcJNQnYybHUosfC3yJnw.text: Friday night hike in Vegas heat and it is suggested that we take refreshments at John Cutter, the nearest bar to Red Rock Canyon. I've driven by many times but never been tempted to go in, probably because of the location in a sleepy shopping area anchored by Albertsons.  It's quite cool inside, high tables , lots of tvs and nice moody lighting. I'm fascinated by the staff, I have a vision of an interview process that involves the following conversation: Q " Will you wear this very tiny tank top?"  A " it looks very small......but ok"   "you're hired"  Yes, it's Hooters in the 'burbs'. A bad thing? Depends.  Anyway, pots of beers and wines, the food , especially the burgers are huge, Michelle Obama would be seriously p&$/:ed. I took a chicken flatbread thing with some feta cheese and tomatoes and it was pretty good. One of the group took some Pot Stickers that looked a little too deeply fried for my liking but she was happy. Other guys took monster burgers and were satisfied.  I don't know what I think......it was ok but we are lucky to live in Vegas with so many choices and a Yelp app, I will try it again.

HCk34uAdLA2pLfoUniR9zg.text: This has become our "go-to" spot on Sunday nights for the half off steaks. I love the waitress's and I would give 5 stars if it wasn't for the hostess who seems to hate her job when we come in each Sunday. It almost sets the mood for an uncomfortable meal when the hostess makes you feel unwanted. I don't know her name but she's got almost shoulder length brown hair. Upon walking in she says "it's going to be awhile" almost hoping you'll walk away it seems. Instead we always give our name/number. We tried breakfast this time on this Saturday afternoon. Well breakfast and lunch. My b/f got surf n turf and I got the JC omelet. I'd recommend the Sunday steaks half off after getting past the poor attitude with the hostess. We'll be back for sure. And just to add, Alexus is the best waitress in my opinion. I think that's her name anyway. She's blonde and ALWAYS in great mood, it makes for a better meal when your waitress is in a good mood.

5AOSTc8vA98RYNJQlGx4jQ.text: Wow...I'm really shocked at all the low reviews.  This is a place that I actually miss after leaving Vegas for Seattle.  Their steaks are some of the best I've eaten in town.  They don't have a freezer on-site so all the steaks are bought fresh and moved out fast.  On Sundays, all steaks are half off.  I miss eating their steak and eggs breakfast (which is available any day) and going for a hike out at Red Rock.  It's an excellent value for only $11!  They don't give you a shit piece of steak that's paper thin, full of fat & gristle like a lot of the casinos advertising cheap steak and eggs (to get you in the door to gamble.)    I like the darker interior of the restaurant and the large and somewhat secluded booths.  As for the service, I've never had any issues with any of the servers.  Skinny Jen is my favorite waitress there and has always done a damn fine job!  The only single issue I've ever experienced was one time we decided to sit outside on the patio on the far left side of the restaurant.  We had to move as we could smell the dumpster located in the parking lot due to the wind blowing in between the two buildings.  We were relocated to a different table outside and enjoyed a fantastic meal.

0F95gvaXIDHMhzCWcVv6oA.text: We ate at John Cutters Friday night. My husband and I both ordered the way over priced NY Strip with a salad. No where on the menu does it tell you that the steak is covered in chili oil.  That is a very specific taste and NOT what people usually expect when ordering a steak. My husband sent his back and I ate mine. I've been sick all weekend. My stomach just could not handle the chili oil. Never eating here again.

1LPl2vYKzGGoqakzCu8X-A.text: John cutters is a friendly atmosphere , great food that doesn't seem like bar food, high quality meats, the waitresses are great, we have been here many times, the people are great, love the location!!!

knWroMbAM0wuaI103RAiRw.text: We decided to go here because they are part of the Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Dining program (we wanted the points). We went about 5pm Saturday night and there were only a few people in the restaurant. They told us to sit anywhere so we chose a booth. The waitress came right over and took our drink order. I needed a couple minutes to look at the menu so she said she would come back. When she brought or drinks we ordered. Didn't take long for the food to arrive. BBQ chicken sandwich for me and philly cheese steak for hubby (he got the full and it was huge). Food was good. The staff was great.

TU9-0uVh6Qgasi81tz6Pog.text: The good- probably the best steak I have had this year! The bad- Way too dark to even read the menu, too many tables and chairs and stools at the bar making it hard to move, and  music that appeals to folks in their 20's who are not gamers. If I am going out to game, I want music enjoyed by folks 40 to 60. I'll go one more time but if a bar wants gamers, play their music. If I hear more of the crap music, I'll leave, never to lose my money their again.

9r59a2R7NP_Hx3ZMXzqCvQ.text: My wife and I went here for breakfast after hiking at red rock.  Service was slow and there were 3 waitresses and only 6 tables in the restaurant that the 3 of them combined were supposed to be taking care of.  Food was great but a bit pricey.

c6X40J1FMt7suPY3Vqbe9w.text: On vacation we stopped for lunch and were pleasantly surprise at the "cool" inside. It's got a lot of wood and nice ambiance. Low lights and pub feel to it. Our server was Sarah and she was very friendly. She took our drink orders right away and our food order as soon as our drinks arrived. I had the 1/2 order Philly Fries and my husband had the Filet Mignon Salad. My Phiily Fries were enough for two people even though it was a half order. The fries weren't my favorite mi like my fries a bit thinner but they were good nonetheless. My husband was very happy with his salad. All in all a good experience.

VTq08Og7ih43z1ukDov-BQ.text: although i like this place most of the time i am really annoyed at theur app/points promo...just nonsense...and annoying

TNDIXIvoM6aS01A27ZI86Q.text: The whole family enjoys eating here, especially the kids. They get a huge chocolate cake with their meals so they usually are really good during dinner. Sundays they have 1/2 off steaks. I love the shrimp tacos. The staff is nice. The only thing that we don't enjoy is how dark it is inside. That's not enough to keep us away when we want a family friendly dinner so we eat here about once a month.

C89wIdNqMnuwlkalrEbZXQ.text: The food was fantastic!  Steak done perfectly and the fact is was half price made it taste better.  The space is "cozy".....that's code for tiny and crowded.  Still, the food was so good that it didn't really matter.  The only bad thing I have to say is our waitress's breath was so bad I could see it!  I was literally leaning away from her it was horrible!  Please ladies, if you smoke, brush your teeth before getting that close to a customer!  UGH!

0bexsNJtRnF-g4L7-zxzOg.text: The Mexican menu is rad. The JC Wet Burrito is amazing... Highly recommend it. Try the chips and salsa as well but be warned... The salsa is no joke.

7Kbk7cwR6pfYSUUD0BZZNw.text: I bought a Groupon to have brunch here so my friend and I went on a Sunday morning about 11:30. The decor and actual restaurant was nice, but for the place not being all that busy, the service was awful. We were there for over a half hour before they even took our order (2 breakfast burritos with bacon instead of sausage and a side of avocado). It took another 45 minutes for us to get our food and when it arrived my friend's order was incorrect because our waitress apparently had put in 3 burritos, not two, and the first one was missing the sauce it came with and the second one had sausage not bacon. They also forgot the side of avocado and when they finally brought it out it was old and brown. We finished eating and had to ask a different waitress for our check since it was now going on 2 hours and we couldn't find our waitress. When the waitress brought our check, she still had the 3rd breakfast burrito on the check so we had her remove it and when she brought the check back it had said they removed both the avocado and 3rd burrito due to "customer complaint" which seemed a little odd and rude, especially since we didn't even order a 3rd burrito.  We were not the only ones struggling with poor service. We witnessed one couple move from their table outside to a table inside and then to the bar after waiting for so long and other couples just left. We also saw someone come in from outside to ask for to-go boxes and their check because they had been waiting so long.  Overall the food was decent and the restaurant was nice and cozy, but neither of those things would make me return just because the service was so bad.

qjT1SNm7F4Jy5-JNsmrwAQ.text: For a Wednesday night, which is a slow night, the service was just ok.  It took a long time to get everything.  I would only come to this place to drink.  It is in the neighborhood and I have been wanting to try it out for a long time.  They have a unique menu and a nice bar environment with a full bar.  There were 2 2 tops when we were there and about 7 people sitting at the bar.    Food: Wings and Fries from Appetizer menu and A Fat Tire (Beer). The wings were breaded and we asked for medium bc server said they were hot.  Which they were not.  We added a side of Ranch and Hot Sauce to make them more spicey.  They seemed like they were just re-heated or even pre-made.  I am a wing girl and live for them...was not impressed at all.  The only good thing is they were not small and had more meat on them then most places.    Service: Forget servers name, its all women staff, she was blond with long hair.  She was really nice, sweet, good looking.  It took us 10 min after ordering our waters to get them.  I ordered my beer after we ordered the water and wings and it came out with my meal.  You can see all the food up (when its ready) and our meal sat there for a good 10 minutes (who is timing anyways).  She did apologize for taking so long bc she was "cleaning" at 10pm when the bar closes at 2ish and the happy hour starts at midnight.  Must have been pretty dirty...  Overall I would come with friends if I was staying in the neighborhood and just drinking. I would most likely sit at the bar too, if there is an open spot.  I am not knocking this place completley, I saw they have breakfast on Sat and Sundays so they can possibly redeem themselves.  Since the weather is nice I want to be able to bring the dogs and sit on the patio as well.  Hope the service wont be terrible there too.  If so I have no problem walking up to the barkeep/tender to order drinks.

Fvxhrrgzn4GhAVIDcmgOOg.text: Think it is little pricy...but the food is great. Service is amazing..all female..and super friendly! Will be back for sure!

2Zs0zkuyQVnzV5uJFHhz8w.text: This is my Sunday Funday dining spot. I must clarify by saying I have only been here on Sunday, which is when they have their all day 1/2 price steak special.  I am actually on the brink of being a vegetarian, but John Cutters maintains that I never make the actual leap by luring me with its delicious cuts of never frozen meats. I die a little inside with each bite of my petite medium done steak and whisper it words in romantic Italian. Okay okay, so I also highly recommend the JC salad. The inside is small and dark with lots of dark wood decor, so keep that in mind when deciding what kind of ambiance you want to have for your meal. If you want something brighter and more cheery you are in luck! Recently they put in an outdoor patio dining area. This place holds lots of potential to be a great date spot, but not on Sundays. It gets pretty busy and you are only able to make reservations for 6 or more. Drinks are always good, but pricey. Tall cans of PBR are a steal. Kudos to the hiring manager! The staff is super friendly and they are all adorable. They also remember your usual food and drink order. Only once did I have a server (Iv never seen her again) that I really wished would do us all a real service and finish up her GED.

KBQ8vv62AJOAsmBvKJCrDQ.text: We go here once a month for the location and food. I love the philly cheese fries and the steak salad. My boyfriend had the ribs last night and they were meaty and flavorful. Rib special friday! Service is always excellent. Very attentive staff.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tacos
Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs!

d5LLAbreDDuhEtHNvNGiQQ.text: We keep going back. We live 1/2 a mile away. Meet other local friends there. Sometimes the food is great, sometimes not so much. Prices are good. The girls are cute and funny. But hell, it's LV, where aren't the waitresses cute and funny.

bxPT6BBLSVrZnQ5WyrdVcg.text: I can pretty much sum up John Cutter's with this simple statement; Their menu consists of 2 pages of food and 4 pages of information and pictures of their all female serving staff. That was my first red flag. As for location and feel, John Cutter's has it right. Easy to access, outdoor patio with occasional live music, and a large, open space inside. But that's where I stopped being impressed. I was told by a few "regulars" of this establishment that the food was mind blowingly good. I always take such statements with a grain of salt, and for good reason... And as I type this, some salt prolly would have helped some of the food a bit.  I had the Chile Relleno, given that this was a Tex-Mexish menu. My parents got the Lobster and Ribs. My Chile Relleno had about as much flavor as loofa covered in cheese. The Spanish rice was bland at best, the beans were runny and just plain sad. The Chile Relleno it's self was cooked well, but lacked any flavor or kick. It tasted like no one in the kitchen has tasted it in quite some time. I also got to have a rib and some of the lobster. The "famous" ribs had a BBQ sauce that massively overpowered the meat. BBQ sauce is good on ribs of course, but the meat should have some kind of flavor! The sauce should be the sidecar to the meat's tender motorcycle, but this was more like a tandem bicycle with two chimps peddling. The lobster was also cooked well, but lacked any wow factor. Even dipped in their butter sauce I still wasn't wowed one bit. The best thing I actually tried here was one of the salads that had nuts in it. It was well dressed and had great flavors that worked well with each other. But if you pride yourself as a respectable Eatery and your best offering is the salad, something's gotta change. I give John Cutter's 2 stars, one for having a good IPA beer available, and one for the other 4 pages of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chilie &#34;Blah&#34;lleno

8tFSb7NVQHMpw9yremtJ3g.text: We dined in and the food was pretty good.  I would considering ordering out from them in the future if we tried again. The inside is so dim and the worst part it smelled like a frat house.  That stinky, stale, sticky beer on the floor smell and I swear I kept getting a whiff of barf in my booth.  It wasn't that I didn't enjoy the food, but I definitely did not enjoy the experience.

xiR9RnqKywXw86fsT1Mgcg.text: We thought we would try something new. Thanks to Groupon, John Cutter was our choice. We really liked the atmosphere when we walked in. Plus you have the option of sitting outside. Service was friendly and it was a very relaxed setting. We ordered the cheesy Cajun chicken penne and carne Asada tacos. The food was good. Nothing spectacular but good. Not sure that we'll return. But glad we tried it once.

7aMbWUha7yD2NqrMYBa2sw.text: Our party of 4 sat outside on their patio and loved chatting and catching up. We had a few entrees and some drinks.  The server was friendly and attentive and checked up on us often which is appreciated when sitting outside.  I hate dining outdoors somewhere and then feel like they forgot about us.  Thumbs up to a nice neighborhood restaurant/bar.  They serve a pretty good burger.

MjnOlYFty47iJyUn40v-DA.text: Do you want to be ignored for an hour or so while you over pay for whatever you order? Then this place is perfect! I would seriously give this place zero stars however the food was OK, so I wanted to give the chef some credit because the food was average.  For anyone interested in a authentic "Asian Salad", this place isn't so perfect. However if instead of "Asian greens" you would like some "shredded iceberg lettuce", and instead of "crispy asian noodles" you would like "dry roasted peanuts from CVS", then this Asian Salad is a real winner! My fiance and I unfortunately wanted the actual Asian Salad so the iceberg lettuce w/ dry roasted peanuts didn't really hit the spot.  I had a BBQ Chicken sandwich and that was ok, probably the highlight of the meal. With regard to the service, it went from bad, to worse, to embarrassingly bad, to literally the worst experience we've ever had in Las Vegas. For example when we were ordering drinks there was probably a 3-4 second pause while deciding, and the waitress barked, "so have you made up your mind or do you just want water?!!!". There were also numerous other comments at the various stages of the meal that were just not what we're accustom to when we go out to dinner. How about a "please", a "thank you",  an "is everything ok?", or a "do you guys need anything?", etc, etc. We received none of this,even the check just came flying from out of the corner of my eye as she bolted by before I could order another beer, or we could order dessert!   It felt like this poor girl was a displaced worker of the night who was really just wasn't happy in the service industry....I mean the "food service" industry. Anyway there are 100000001 places to eat in Vegas where you can get a good meal, good drinks, and good service at a good price, no need to go here unless you are too happy and want to get a little depressed over dinner.  Ron out-

mRVbOhn1E0J8V9VMh5_05w.text: I was very excited to go to JC. We see it all the time because we live almost across the street from it. We read up and found out about their 1/2 off steaks on Sunday's and thought that would be perfect.   I'm gonna save me some time and effort by stating that the food was pretty good. On food alone I would have given about 4 stars. But alas I don't review based on food alone. Being in the customer service industry I have a keen eye and sense for how things should be done.   So here we go....we walked in and no hostess was at the door. A server brushed by us and quickly muttered the hostess will seat you momentarily. So we stood there in the doorway waiting. Finally the woman who spoke to us figured out the hostess wasn't coming and sat us herself.   Next...our server arrived. In unpolished form. Very unprofessional in appearance, speech, and attitude. (perhaps JC should hire on ability and not on whether or not you have breast implants and a mildly cute face) She then took our orders.   I joined their text message coupon service and showed the server that we have a coupon for a free drink. (which later when the bill came was not free. She forgot) We ordered an appetizer. It came rather quickly. That was nice. But alas again. No plates or utensils.   Food arrived. We had ordered the 18oz ribeye which was huge so we decided to split it. No extra plate to cut it on. Wonderful.   We waited 10 minutes for the check after she took away our plates after we finished. Then another 10 minutes to show her the drink error. We were so unimpressed with the service. Very sad.

IYuXy-Zfp4we8mnhOIuAkw.text: Weekend all day specials are awesome. Saturday is Surf & Turf. Sunday is half price steaks. Best steakhouse in Vegas. Other restaurant steaks have left me wishing I went to John Cutters, not only are the other places not as good they are 2 to 3 times more expensive.

B_TIZBLPelR6rBdRCoRz8A.text: I've been told about this place for the last year, mainly by my regular cab driver (you can't possibly live in Vegas and think you can have a bloody mary or 3 and then drive home) who drives one of the bartenders from here.    Having tired of the tasteless food at Red Rock after bingo, we decided to venture over the I-215 bridge and try it out.    1st: it is NOT fat friendly if you are on the hippy side.  They only have 3 types of seating.  Outside skinny bottomed armed chairs; inside you have your choice of high-boy bar chairs or cramped booths.  So just a bit of a warning before you go.    While we were seated quite quickly (in the ever shrinking cramped booth) our waitress was very slow getting us drinks..a standard Bloody Mary and a beer.   We were on the fence about the menu but it was, after all, a bar.   My dinner companion ordered the surf and turf..surf being 2 large lobster tails and turf being a huge ribeye.  Appx 35.00 for the plate.  It comes with a side salad that our waitress repeated after each entree order was placed (down to the pine nuts).  I ordered the steak fajita tacos with a side of Mac & Cheese.  My son, who was left at home, called in his order for pork chops which are on the web menu but apparently have been removed from the actual menu.    Surf & Turf:  I had a piece of the turf (surf allergy) and it was FANTASTIC.  The rib eye was cooked to perfection. Tender Juicy and spiced just right.    Fajita Tacos:  Even without the standard condiments of salsa/sour cream they were delicious.  The meat was tender, delicious and in abundance topped by just the right combination of onions/peppers.    Side Mac/Cheese:  light and flavorful.  Not your blue box variety, but a very nice blend of white cheeses in elbow macaroni.  Served in a steel pot.    If you can squeeze into the booth, don't mind the airheadedness of the wait staff and their continuous need to be posers, the sticker shock of the bill (2 drinks, 3 entrees, no dessert - $120.00), then it is well worth it for the food.    I will go again but will make it a to-go box while I sip my coffee from the fabulous Dunkin' next door.  Update:  We've been back 3 times since I wrote this.  Got take out for the steaks.  Still no "regular" seating outside.  It's sad because we are stuck on steak there and they probably have other good things but until they fix their seating situation my little group will never find out.  Note: you cannot be 6'8" and sit in the high top chairs.  it just doesn't work.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary

XgDD0A4rdNSRcfq_p56i4g.text: OK, so John Cutter is a prime example of "If you build it, they will come" logic.  The Vistas sprout up and then this place came along.  Living here, I had long avoided it because of the magnetic pull of the place to SUVs, sloppy cougars, and the men that solicit them.  It just seemed like a place to avoid, which is unfortunate since there are no other real restaurants west of the 215.  Then along came the groupon and I thought, maybe I should try it since it is so close.  These are the things I have learned in doing so: -The menu is printed in the worst-of-Vegas style with one page of drinks and one of food and 4 pages devoted to the "servers" (use of quotation marks definitely meant to imply irony).  -The servers are really only hired on the merits of their cup size or degree of time spent on a hair-and-tan ratio.  They will rarely know what is on the menu, they will put your order in wrong, they will be confused about many things.  It is important to know this going in; Don't even try to place a to go order by phone.  If you can sit at a table covered by the Asian server, do so; she is the only one in a few visits who is always on the ball and gets things correct the first time. I am awarding a star just because she took the hassle level down here big style.  -The bar kind of melts into the four booths that are the restaurant side of the room.  It is a surprisingly small space.  If one person lights up at the bar, the entire place will wreak of smoke.  -The happy hour ends at 6pm which is kind of backwards.  Be aware of this fact.  -DO NOT GO HERE ON A FRIDAY NIGHT unless...you are going to sit on the patio and listen to questionable dirty-t-shirt type of live music.  IF you are inside they will simply crank the poorly-curated music to combat this.  The result will be a loss of appetite (why so much Justin Beiber in the rotation, why, for love of all that is good and sacred, why?) and  a loss of hearing.  Everyone indoors will start yelling for their companions to hear them.  It's not a good system...  And now maybe a little bit about the actual food here?   -Whoever said the food is "mind-blowing" needs to get out more.  The food is average, decent for bar food.  Due to the servers' low aptitudes you don't always get things as ordered which is a pain in the ass when you order a burger rare and it comes to you well done.  Or you order dressing on the side and your salad arrives weighed down by it.  -When the food is ordered and delivered correctly it is OK.  But damn if it is INCONSISTENT.  Lunch is your best bet, followed by Monday through Thursday EARLY dinner.  If you go in on a Friday night, the size of the food will be halved and there is no manager to ask about it.  On  the other times, the helpings will be almost double as large.  And last but not least, why this place is actually getting a yelp review from me...the sacrilege that is the Philly cheesesteak items (sandwich and fries).  As a Philly native I know that I am going to be more prone to being offended by these things, but frankly, putting mushrooms into the mix is just sick and wrong.  I love mushrooms, but they have no place in these recipes.  Onions, yes, but you put too little in there.  Peppers, add them please.  I won't even get into how your cheese sauce is so off the mark.  But for the love of all that is right in this world, stop with the mushrooms already.

yJUgk7UH62ivQfkUQo0nYA.text: I want to give 5 stars, but every time we are on the patio the service is soooo slow! I get it, out of sight out of mind~but when I want a beverage, 28  minutes is not so cool! Their Philly cheesesteak is awesome and so is their spring rolls. I will keep coming back because they are super friendly to my pup, and I love the patio vibe.

-NGhgYahdaE4rEEbKbbmQQ.text: Kristie & Jenny were helping us out tonight, worst bartenders we have experienced at this place. We had a comp for our anniversary and they couldn't figure out what to do with it. Jenny was new and didnt know what to do with our comp but Kristie argued with us when we got our bill about the comp. we had been gambling all night, she finally informed us that 'everywhere in Vegas is the same and you need to out 20 in the machine to get comped'  we weren't looking for our tab to be comped but we were playing at the bar and an extra drink would be nice here and there considering we ARE Locals. I also have to complain about the food. We ordered the queso fundido and it can out cold. I stuck my finger to the boton if the bowl and it was not hot! I was yoo aftaid to send it back for fear they would spit in my food. Too bad this place is so close to the house. I finally remember why I only visit once a year. UlulxbJ44UytkQGiF2lL_w.text: Just ate at John Cutter for dinner. It was amazing. We started with the Philly cheese fries as an appetizer. The fries are thick cut and crispy. The meat was tender and flavorful.  I would get this dish again. For my meal I had the ranch chicken wrap. While it was very good, I'm not sure if I'd order it again. Only because there were so many AMAZING options on the menus, I'm convinced this isn't what they're known for. Next time, I might ask the server for suggestions.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ranch chicken wrap. Side salad was enormous and delicious. I liked the salad better than the wrap itself!!
Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly Cheese Fries. Bomb!! Savory, gooey, golden and crispy.

SZfx0Y3IZHriYeYSXwfUXQ.text: I came to try the steak since everyone raved about it. It is cooked well. But then again so does my better half. It's all in the cooking, having a great piece of meat helps. We ordered ours rare and it was. It's seasoned well so you don't really need A1. Yes it's also half off on Sunday's. We didn't go on a Sunday. I think I will though. It's only across the street from me. I have not tried their burger so cannot write about it. I didn't bother with any sides because I only care for steak. Cheese on fries really is not my thing and I have yet to taste any cheese fries that tastes good. I love steak fries dipped in A1 or the juice from the steak. So all in all if you want a good steak. This place is good. And that's what I came for. Ribeyes really don't need anything if you cook it right. The natural marbled fat cooks itself. If you sear it correctly you get a nice crust. Service was about average. Not stellar or bad really. But then again we are easy to please. I will write another review when I try the burger.

A64zS_rvZn8OcghFsgnJTw.text: Place has gr8 steaks especially on 2 for 1 Sundays.  Service is mediocre.  Sports bar atmosphere w/typical bar food.  Loved their rib eye.  Seating outside is an option.

sPVhS3wBlzd1gUKlOQ-ftw.text: Always a good time to enjoy the fun vibe of this West side gin mill. Sexy staff, good food and good times always!

rVb09fzuggrt-Pw-lp8P0w.text: I have tried three times to love this place. The food is great! The service by the waitresses is horrible! They are great when they introduce themselves and then they are never seen again. A runner brings the food. We watched on all three times, when we wanted a refill, a group of servers talking and texting. Then, each time looked irritated to have to come over. Sad.

T-KRs6PzZ1v71YLmrWi48w.text: Went to john cutters last Sunday, the food was amazing. We sat at the bar and had wonderful service from our bartender Lisa, my friend and I had a great time and the best Bloody Mary I have had in a long time. We will be back

fgQEAOfhica2PPPHyM6TDQ.text: Carrot cake is HUGE and really great. Burgers are delicious. Fettuccine Alfredo with steak was also great. Waitress was attentive and polite. Cost was reasonable, and on the low end for some items.

lQ-iBfjFbKX4R2sfZt_k8g.text: Cutter is up on Charleston on the way to R.R. Canyon.  My partner & I had a Groupon so decided to give it a try.  We arrived at 5:00 to a very noisy pub/restaurant with raunchy music that denied anyone a conversation.  I ordered chicken lettuce wraps & he chose a Philly steak sandwich.  It was slow in coming, as were the orders of the couple who arrived before us.  I was ready to wolf it all down (hunger pangs) but alas!  The lettuce pieces were small & the chicken had a sap-sucker sweetness that seared my tongue.  I requested they replace it with the Asian chicken salad.  Not a good idea.  It was made with the limpy Chinese cabbage,  the hard white pieces of regular cabbage, & big square hunks of red bell pepper.  The dressing tasted  straight out of a La Choy bottle, but being so hungry, I devoured most of it.  My partner's Philly steak was on a lackluster bun, contained no green peppers or onions, but the steak fries were good.  Our server was friendly l& anxious to please, though forgot to fill his coffee cup.  I can't give Cutter a better score than a 2 on a 1-5 scale.  And why return?

IEGYulM9CqURFXsHCz687w.text: We've been here at least a half dozen times.  Their burgers are great, but the last 4 times the steak came out too salty and had to send it back. Tonight the steak was not cooked to "between medium & medium well" but it came out on the rare side. The lobster was not cooked enough and had to send it back.  The new  steak came back well done and the lobster came back smelling fishy and tasted water-logged. We informed the waitress and she was sorry but didn't do anything else but maybe she couldn't. Needless to say, we felt very disappointed.  We probably won't be back any time soon.

wyIymzyVb45UPohQm6ak9A.text: The employee's are the worst, the evening bartender needs to committed to a facility to deal with her mental health issues. The servers are an insult to the profession, they act like they are doing you a favor by speaking to you.  Amy, the hostess is the best, after she seats you it becomes a horrible experience. I have been told Andre Aggasi is s part owner, if so  I have no idea why he would allow these employee's to act the way they do. If you are having a good day don't ruin it by going here. Homer W.

BfZZ3D5LUrjMzq-VgspENg.text: Great food, good service, fantastic location but...  .... how can you NOT HAVE DRAFT BEER? What pairs better with the signature steak and lobster than a cold, fresh draft?   Guys, get some kegs in. Even next door at Al's Garage they have a few drafts... miserable ones... but there's an option.  Get a good light beer, an IPA, a classic Belgian beer and a Hefe.  We literally choose go elsewhere sometimes because we love a draft beer with our meal.   I can get a bottle at home. :)

q6V3NWOfUamZCfYyC2lapw.text: Hands down the Summerlin spot on Saturday. Machines are flowing and sports on tv. Not to mention the best steak and lobster special around. Come see Jess and Danny you will never be disappointed

NDcFQVshkXb5wh8VqdKxAw.text: Pleasantly surprised! I heard a few people mention this place a while ago and I just happen to see it on Groupon and decided to give it a shot since I live in the neighborhood. You walk in and seat yourself so don't except someone to seat you. This restaurant is open 24 hours which is cool. It's a dark bar but nice. My server was prompt and friendly. I ordered the petite filet and it came with a side salad which was good and cheap even without a Groupon! Only $21 full price. This is not an echo & Rig steak but on point with pricing. They have half off steak on Sundays as well. I'd come back to try other things on the menu for sure. Cool local spot.

6SkxVZqRZFalwj9WUGtXQQ.text: Poor customer service along with fraudulent charges. Went there for a couple of drinks at night. Bartender at night ignored me while trying to serve his friends at the other side of the bar. Only order 2 shots and tipped the guy 5$ on my CC and ended up seeing a 20$ tip on my statement. Had to call my bank to dispute this charge because the bartender is adding his own fake charges. Be ware of this dishonest place. Should put that guy in jail for the most part.

3GIP_a5FPrMu7SBeHAAR0Q.text: I have been here several times with mostly good experiences.  On this visit, the food was good, but the service was the worst I had in a very long time anywhere.  The server came around to take the order, and that was it.  The food runner brought out the food.  The server did not check on us to see if everything was ok, no drink refills, not even a look in our direction.  We had to ask another employee for the check.  Once she brought it, she did not come back around to pick it up.    We did see her scurrying between her other tables, so I'm not sure it was all her fault.  That leads me to believe that either they were short staffed or there are inefficiencies in they way they handle the tables.  It is quite possible that management is at least partially to blame, but as a server, there are basics that must be done no matter what.  On the small bright side, for the 10 seconds we saw her, she did seem friendly.    It is really a shame that something as simple as service can ruin what would have been a nice meal.  There are too many other places to go to put up with this lack of service.

9cJQkA1d4MyIcrh4BBPiGQ.text: If there was a way to give this place negative stars I would. Food is horrid. Service even worse  I don't know a bar that doesn't sell draft beer. Why do you have to wait 40 min for frozen food?!!!

zKBfwV9FE2hHkw2Ujl1low.text: Adam is good at excuses but still doesn't change the issues with both restaurants, instead of blaming reviews maybe replace yourself

KPMUPqW1RpaKIs_AASAAsw.text: How do I even start . customer service is 100% amazing. Danny and his staff are always attentive. Danny rememberers me when I sit down . He always  entices me with the amazing food menu even when I am not hungry I still order take out and thankful when I enjoy it at home and there as well . And the machines are great !!so sorry i can't complain .. Definitely a place I feel comfortable at with company or by myself.... and by myself means a lot to feel so comfortable at our neighborhood stop ..

if75O3lQ4_LdBaGqienhvA.text: I really was hoping for a positive experience at John Cutters, but unfortunately it fell far short than my expectations and stellar reviews that have been posted months ago.  The only thing positive about my experience was the French fries that accompanied my bacon cheeseburger were very hot and quite good.  Other than that, I found the service to be quite friendly when our server would come around which wasn't very frequently.  The burger itself tasted as though the meat was freezer burned and so greasy that the bottom of the  bun was totally saturated in grease.  My friend that accompanied me ordered the same and said that exact same thing.  The place was very busy.  Maybe an off night??  Not sure I'm willing to try again for the high prices we paid....

5Y0sLeyUKRnHXWUEzLhg1w.text: I'm not sure why this place has low stars. The only bad things are....awhile back they staff wasn't too friendly-mainly bartenders...and I ate there a few times for lunch and it was winter time and they had both doors wide open and frigid air was blowing through the place....  But the positives are---it's so close to my house so I could drink and walk home if I wanted to..... The half off cheeseburgers on Tuesday's are soooo yummy!  The new bartender I met a few nights ago was super friendly!  I tried the filet nachos and the portion size of the half was HUGE!!! so delicious with all the beer I had.  Both cutters and toros are not bad options--and open 24 hours so when you get hungry at 1 am like me...options!

Q4VhoJU8g9MA2aUHYsI93w.text: Absolutely love this place! My brother took us here when I first moved here @ 3 or so years ago. Specifically for their Sunday steak specials. For you who don't know. Cutters runs a 1/2 off steak special for 24 hours on Sundays. Wow. Their 10oz filey, usually $32, sells for (yes) $16. It's truly fabulous. Cooked perfect, and served on top if a slightly spiced chili oil. All sides are separate and worth the prices. Huge. Mac n cheese to die for, and their Cesar salad is done just right. (We serve it too, at Bambinos pizza, so I know good cesar!) Heathers been our server a few times now, and she's a True asset to this place. Always cheerful and helpful no matter how busy she gets. We'll go back, again n agsin n again...

ckvv6cFUGD04IgJxfBlyCQ.text: As we sit here at the back of restaurant I can't help but think that every waitress in the place likes my behind. Every time one walks behind me, they say "behind". Imagine my flattery, up till the moment  My wife explained to me that they are announcing behind as we are seated at near the serving counter and didn't want another server backing into them.   Well, I was feeling sexy for a moment!  This place rocks. Food is awesome and usually has live entertainment on the weekends.  Update as of this date: This restaurant has gone to crap. Their Philly Cheese Fries used to be to die for. Today, they are literally about 50 cents per French fry. My wife and I have been ordering this side for years and have always been satisfied with the portion. Today the portion is likened to that of a order of fries from a kids happy meal.   As a twice a week customer (party of 6) we will not be back.   Used to be able to order a half order or a full order. Then they stopped the half order. As of today, their full order is half of their half order. Same price though as their full order. $13.00.   Bad management decision that lost a customer. Yes... i will post this review on every social media outlet I am affiliated with.

Aj6KEOzmovnVT8weNMp_zg.text: I love John Cutters. Well except for their funky rules like no take out on Sunday and Monday nights because of Football. The staff is always friendly and the food is great. Their cutters salad is amazing. I also love their burgers and cheesesteaks. The atmosphere is great. I especially love evenings over the summer when they have live music outside. I do wish they offered draft beer.

wJmmUNPsreXlg5RuvKZ3GQ.text: I came here specifically for the $6 burger on Tuesdays. It was a random last-minute visit, and, I'd say that you are getting your bang for the buck because the burger is enormous. So enormous, that you can finish about half of it and be stuffed. I personally wasn't too fond of the burger at all even though it was a good price.   However, I have been thinking about their Philly cheesesteak fries, and had cravings for it days after my visit. It was sooooooooo good. I was pleasantly surprised at the tender/juicy/fatty quality of the steak that is chopped up on top. The cheese sauce is the nacho cheese type that's melted (which I normally can't stand), but it worked well with this dish, and I really thought it was legit. Unfortunately, that was regular price. I'd for sure come back for those fries though.

1TYW38E0yaOj1XEc9Sufdg.text: Always like coming here, foods are delicious and waitresses are always so sweet! Generous portions too.

ho7_C6yTaK0mOvhPfDdPMg.text: John Cutters is my go to place for steaks especially on Sundays. (psst they are half off!)  The steaks here are so good that I don't need any steak sauce . I've been to steak houses on the strip, and Summerlin but I prefer John Cutters. The steak is so juicy! My husband who likes his well done said even his was tender and juicy even though his was cooked well. I like getting the fully loaded potato with my meal. The potato is huge enough to share but there have been days where we want two sides . We flock to the Mac and cheese as our second choice.  The food is wonderful so it can get pretty crowded on a Sunday evening. Especially since the space isn't that big. If you want steak they serve it throughout the day so I would try to head there for an early lunch!

dH-yTYZI8h3iJujY5d9Wrw.text: We love love love this place.   Best burger without a doubt.   Their JC salad is to die for.  Great waitresses also.  Bartenders are fantastic and very friendly.  Whoever owns this place did it right.   We go once a week.

9UJ0st4bgehax5_wvUnrQQ.text: I would not recommend this place. It's overpriced and they really ration you with the meat. Paid $12 for BBQ chicken. Just bits of chicken on a large dry tasteless roll. Really disappointed.

x1aUZSnsMxrEt7j23kM9hQ.text: I used to be a fan of John Cutter the Krolly sandwich and the Philly were favorites, fries and salads had also been tasty. That is until our most recent visit earlier this week. It's been a few months since we stopped in, they've since revamped the menu.   Krolly sandwich got the boot so my husband tried the chicken sandwich and he ordered dynamite rolls to start. Luckily I was still able to get the Philly.  The rolls weren't exactly dynamite, they were terribly dry on their own. The sauce helped a lot. The chicken sandwich was no better. Dry was the word of the day. He slathered it in ranch dressing to make it edible. Good news is the French fries are still tasty. Bad news is my Philly was a disaster. The meat was tough, the bread was dense and stale; it was dripping with cheez-whiz and it still found a way to be ridiculously dry. The salad used to be a favorite, they had a great champagne vinaigrette. Not no more. It was bland and way under-dressed.   Sad to say, John Cutter has bit the dust.
