AMuGCED0tFpPBr2B2oaFKg.text: Still waiting for our food. Sat down at 5:10 it's 6:10 and haven't seen my salad. We ordered 2 lettuce wraps as appetizers  and they served them with no plates or silverware. Asked 4 people for silverware no one helped. Finally after the food was cold we received wet plates for 4 we were a party of 6. Now waiting for my salad nothing yet.  Waitress at no time offered to bring out hot food.  Just received the salad. Food seems good but server terrible and uncaring. She should have sent the manager. I actually asked for one and she ignored me.  My steak came out well done I  ordered it rare. Oy 6:30 no steak. I just had to ask the server for my meal. Oh just got it. Our whole table finished their meal and had to remind the waitress that I am still waiting for my food. Not hungry now. I hope the manager reads this.

Gq7GuTmGu2uW8dEwN-359Q.text: Came today for dinner, place is understaffed only one person at the bar doing everything, sat at the video poker machine and played for 45 minutes, had to borrow menu from person sitting next to me.  Bar tender never checked on us after serving our first drink so I ended up calling  Kravings next door and picked up food to go.  This place is terrible.....

UumkrFY5uWcoJclMxnshDA.text: Food is great but service is terrible, we ordered an appetizer and 2 burger.. waited 20 minutes and then the waitress came to us and told us the cooks forgot to make the dip... So then the dip came out and was on the pickup window for 5 minutes more..then 10 min later we got our burgers but they messed up on my gf's burger so they took it back and once again it was at the pick up window for another 5 minutes.. the waitress were too busy showing each other their phones and not paying attention to customers... I would expect an apology or some type of discount for the terrible experience,but none was given..

2V0GWJcOp5hUqyiJmixZnQ.text: Cool place, live music, simple but great bar food, and interesting drinks. The blueberry lemonade cocktail is delicious and refreshing. The nachos were mediocre and somewhat dissapointing due to the nacho cheese being cold but they made up for it with the Philly cheese steak wrap.Tons of juicy meat coated in gooey cheesy goodness so much wrapped into a burrito wish my stomach was bigger could only finish half! Wish they had more food options but what they do offer is damn good.

yEOpGnpGHpJaCalKuv0h0Q.text: Went back to this place because it's close to where I live and tried the ribs that were on special, they were deep fried and AWFUL. Not enough enough meat on the bone, they were terrible. Like I said in my previous review this place is more of a casino than a restaurant, i'm willing to bet they make nearly all of their money on slot machines. There's plenty of loser Summerlin d-bags who drop a c-note in the machine so they can talk to some cute girl they think will might come home with them.  Like I said in my previous review virtually all of the food and drink is overpriced and sub-par. BTW, the owners have sold the restaurant to one of the girls that worked here, maybe it wasn't profitable enough.  I agree with "Alex N." in his review where he says "I am convinced the wait staff at this place collectively share one brain that is meticulously stored in a jar of jager behind the bar counter."  One of the girls that worked here sent me a message about my last review:  "I have to say reviews are opinions which are here nor there but yours was very disrespectful and hitting the fine line of slander. No employees are under the influence of drugs or alchohal or of any drug. These woman have natural personality and do not need the extra factor you so call speak of. Only one does such activities can accuse others. These women work hard, and do their best at the job. If you have a problem you should maybe not write about on the computer and actually speak to someone about it when you are there."  I like how she couldn't spell alcohol correctly and didn't make much sense with her grammatical errors. I have actually spoke to someone about a problem here. I saw one of the patrons leave the bar intoxicated, driving dangerously fast almost hitting a man that was working outside late at night, only to swerve at the last minute to avoid hitting him. I couldn't believe what I saw so I mentioned it to the bartender inside, hinting that it's not a great idea to let patrons get so intoxicated that they could kill somebody. She said "Maybe the guy shouldn't have been standing there", I couldn't believe her answer.

xW1B7GOykbFIfb6mbFQIUA.text: Steak is great especially on Sunday's... No matter what day I come service is always slow and shitty. Servers can't multi task and by the time they refill a water your done with your dinner.

MFPndOxQxXz5NJOiNPc78A.text: Been here many times. Service is inconsistent. Some of the servers are terrific, some act like the just want to strut around in their Daisy Dukes.  The food is better than average bar food.  I recommend the Caesar Chicken Wrap, Chinese Chicken Salad, Philly Cheese Steak and Chile Rellenos.  Fun atmosphere.  Good place to grab a bar meal.

r6oADZngkSlGDks_5WA4Ig.text: This place is awesome! We live east and have driven across town to this place many times! The environment is really nice. It's a great place to visit. The food is even better. Generous portions and good prices. We don't drink can only comment on the food.

nOoIjO6prOCrgmRyNTbjqw.text: I like many things about this place. The menu is just the right length, the choices include beef, chicken, seafood and it's all well prepared. The side salad is delicious - it's so much better than the typical green salad you get elsewhere. The burger was juicy. The staff is very friendly and pays attention. There is live music which is enjoyable. The outside seating is great. For an evening when you want to get dinner in a relaxed setting without pretention and you live in Summerlin, this place is perfect.

jTzCm7Z9BnfOMTGZaaQzOA.text: Me: little better than standard bar food. Prices decent. Food good and service, meh. Cheese sauce is good. So good, it's used in at least four different dishes. It's in their queso; it's in their Philly cheesesteak; it's in their Philly cheese fries; it's in their mac & cheese; and who knows what else. Seriously though, there Philly cheese fries are pretty amazing. Other than that it's pretty standard bar food. So I must complain about their chicken fingers. Disclaimer: I usually don't order chicken fingers anywhere because I think it's a lazy way to feed kids but if in a bar and with kids, and especially with kids who never get chicken fingers when we eat out, I ordered them. Much to my disappointment they were completely overcooked. By the looks of them they were already the frozen variety. So there wasn't much to cooking them except to watch that they don't--I don't know--get overcooked! It was so disappointing. On the rare occasion we actually order these things I want them to be delicious and just like we eat them every other time before which is usually, delicious. They were so bad and dried out that even my kids couldn't finish one. What kid in the history of American food eating has ever not finished a chicken strip. My four-year-old even asked me when the chicken nuggets were showing up. So I had no other option but to complain. The waitress just shrugged and asked if we needed anything else. To add insult to injury, the chicken strips were the only thing we did not finish and yet the most expensive thing we ordered, and we still had to pay for them.  Him: dad kicking, bad chicken, bad chicken wing on my bad chicken, I hate the chicken so bad chicken that chicken I do not like the chicken that chicken seriously I hate the chicken that chicken that chicken that chicken (using mic feature--haha). Seriously, bad chicken. Ruined the whole dinner because I wanted juicy chicken tenders with my mac and cheese. The lava cake was good. It was so chocolatey and the center had a yummy chocolate that I love, sort of like Hershey's dark chocolate and gooey. Maybe we will go back. It depends if they stop selling that chicken. I hope they stop.

rPCF7fsg0ULTCC6AOhGuEg.text: Just happen to stop in here and it was 1/2 price burger day. The place was super crowded but we had a drink at the bar and waited for a table for about 20min, which was not bad. THe burger were large and I felt very tasty. We enjoyed the meal and the Mgr was nice to chat with as he stopped by the guests tables. We would stop in again.

3M_6JeYYjFdqiZRI2UTJew.text: Bought the $25 gift certificate today and went there tonight.  My server, Heather, was outstanding. Explained to me the rules of the gift certificates and I said no problem. I already knew what I wanted and the meal came to just over the amount I needed to spend.   I ordered the 18 oz bone-in rib eye with blue cheese crumbles and asked for it to be cooked rare "plus". It was cooked perfectly!  Delicious.  The steak had great flavor and comes with a small (ha ha) JC Salad. Refreshing.  If you want sides they are extra, this is the only bad deal.  The service was excellent, just the right amount of coming over to make sure I was happy and didn't need anything else.  Didn't over do it though.   All in all I was really happy about my first time at John Cutter's and will go back.  The server advised me to try Sundays as that is when the steaks are 50% off, though they don't except the gift certificate on specials.  That's ok, as you get a better deal anyways.  She said with Football season here, it is better to get there before 5pm. No problem for a good meal.  :-}

UUbRl6mXiPh4SWH-V4BD4A.text: Nice fast stop in for Sunday Breakfast.  Eat at the bar.  Have a Virgin Mary or not so Virgin.  Either way it is a fun stop.

tK9oKHMc833AG4Cdx9tfXA.text: Excellent neighborhood hang out place.  Love the Sunday half off steak.  Great service.

b167LHEpyB-Shq3jxEKz5g.text: I am relieved to hear that other neighborhood locals have noticed the hit or miss -horrible- service at this place!!!Our neighbor friends agree that it pays off to cross the bridge to go  the Yardhouse or BJs because we know we  will get GREAT service there! But it is such a convenient location for us, that we do stop in there about twice a year only to be painfully reminded why we should never return. If it weren't for the "Steak Sundays" and gaming,( which we partake in neither of) this place would  probably collapse. It wouldn't hurt to remove half of those high tables, then burn those stupid dangling plank window treatments that make an otherwise cozy bar feel like a dungeon. I have seen waitresses struggle to wade through the tables...We have low expectations for the new restaurant -Toros- opening nextdoor to John Shitters because we heard that it is owned by the same company.

sQe0wmPND_tDWBZFccemdQ.text: Went in for New years day for a quick bite to eat. Totally ignored for 15 minutes in the dining area. Sat ourselves, took our own menus. Waitress walked by us countless times, not a peep. Menu looked way over priced anyways. No thanks John Cutter.

f_CVv4xg1TzRwbiNh_R0Rg.text: Very mediocre.   This place is so close to my house, and I wish it had the potential to be a regular happy hour spot, but sadly it does not.   I went roughly 6 months ago, so hopefully some things have changed.   They had no beer on tap... really? Shocking. The food and decor were average. The prices were reasonable.   Until they have beer on tap we will not return.

0QLkQ9iKK4rmNm9Qqy87Yg.text: I've eaten here a ton, as it's one of the closest spots to home.  The food is consistently good, and unlike several of the reviewers here, I'd say the service is consistently good.  They seem to be overstaffed as opposed to understaffed most times we go - and that's a positive.    What to order when you are there?  Sundays are 1/2 price steak night - the steaks are as good as you'll find anywhere for the price (here's a hint...don't order a steak anything but medium or medium rare - you'll kill it, at home or at any restaurant).  Tuesdays are half price burgers - they are big and very good.  The JC salad is very good (two hints - the small portion is huge, but order it on a large plate, and ask for extra pine nuts!).  Breakfast is only served on weekends - if you go, order the French Toast....it's awesome.

il1lx9RS05x94PoNuMsOlw.text: Consistently outstanding service!  Visit after visit  friendly, fast, reliable service.   Immediate acknowledgement when you walk in.  Fast order taking and they keep you entertained by bringing your drinks quickly.  Always happy with this place!!

31_r3oKui5zBXMifwIBRqg.text: Meh. Apparently this is a Summerlin staple but i didn't quite get the hype.  My food was good but definitely not worth the price and the service was sub par.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple martini

aZALmnkcYP_B780Thk7XHw.text: Ehh... it was OK.   I'm not sure if this place is a chain, but if it's not, it seems like it could or should be.  I ordered a philly cheesesteak (half), and it was okay. Could have used a bit more cheese, but maybe that's just me being picky. Salad it came with was good. (How hard is it to mess up a salad though, haha.)  I also ordered a side of mac and cheese -- yes, I was really hungry! Oh my! The mac and cheese was good but SO FILLING. I should have split my mac and cheese with a friend (who also got her own side). I kind of wish the server would have said "hey, that's a lot of food you're getting." I know it's tough to gauge appetites and such but.. yeah.. we had a lot of food, and I hate wasting food.   We were driving back to California, so the food wasn't going to come with us.  I thought it was weird that they didn't have any beers on tap? Not holding that against them.. just thought it a little peculiar.  Also -- the atmosphere is kind of confusing. The building from the outside seems family-friendly, but once inside, it's kind of dark? Maybe that is to keep everything cool since it gets so hot outside? Just a little... I don't know.. confusing.  In case you're wondering how we ended up here: on the way back from Red Rock Canyon. We were looking for some grub before the drive back to SoCal :)  2018: 63/100

AutZjgpW8i9SWtJnwPWtJQ.text: Fist time visiting this steakhouse, worst  Sperience ever . I order the rib eye steak and my friend the new York steak  both medium.  My steak was medium rare and my friends almost well done. We never saw are waitresses she did not come back to the table to ask about the food or to see if we need it drink. We order 2 side dishes FF and bake potato  that we did not got into we were almost about to finish with the steaks. "Not good" FF were saggy and the bake potato dry like if they left it under the heat lamp.  I don't recommend this place to anyone.

V7Q8IIWQgpO_rex8eGDPoA.text: Wow. It's dark in here. Like haunted house dark. I thought our hostess was going to light a torch on the way to showing us to our table.  Having said that, my business lunch here was actually pretty enjoyable. The salads are fresh, well prepared, and full of good flavors. I had the Cobb, which contained some deliciously seasoned chicken, Bleu cheese crumbles, avocado, egg etc. The greens were tossed with a nice balsamic, but it was perfectly dressed. My lunch companion had the Chinese chicken salad, which she described as "really good". It was actually on her recommendation we stopped here. We were working close by and she mentioned she likes to come here for the petite filet.  Service was solid too. Not amazingly fast, but certainly friendly and good with lunch suggestions and drink refills.   I'm glad we stopped. I would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb salad. Very tasty.

kjG9nVc8-v2719cuWHLdzQ.text: John Cutter reminds me of a more intimate and high-end PT's, without the loudness and cigarette smelling atmosphere. The customer service is also excellent. Oh! And much better food! The shrimp cocktail is not your average shrimp cocktail. In fact, it's anything but! Don't let the name fool you - you aren't going to be getting cold, rubbery shrimp to dip in a cold cocktail tail sauce, no. You'll be getting huge, pan fried tiger shrimp, with a hint of black pepper to dip in some butter (and cocktail sauce but didn't care for it). So simple, yet soooo delicious. Server over a bed of lettuce, so you could even make it into a salad if so desire. The Philly Fries will give you that hit-the-spot, artery clogging feeling...but in a satisfying way! French Fries topped with melted cheesy goodness, mushrooms and sliced ribeye (philly cheesesteak style). The ribeye, cheese, mushroom and fries ratio are perfect! My go-to appetizers whenever I go to JC!

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Cocktail
Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly Fries

pttALtlLDL_2mkQ6_bpkqA.text: We started out to go to Toros, only to find the bar about to close and no food. They're in the process of revamping the name, menu, and focus. So here we are, in the boonies, too late to do more driving, and John Cutter was the default option. We had gone there once, long ago, had some sort of major issue, and walked out before ordering. I  remembered that they seemed very expensive.This time we looked at the menu before we went in; apparently all the other restaurants have kept pace and even surpassed them, because the prices were average.  Our server, Vanessa, had a great personality and checked on us frequently. My Riesling, Monchof by brand, was delicious. We both ordered salads - Cobb for my husband, Chinese Chicken for me.   While he liked his a lot, I wasn't as sanguine. I've had this salad many times at multiple restaurants. Here the chicken was good - well-seasoned and plentiful. I liked that I was able to sub romaine for the Asian greens and get the dressing and noodles on the side. The dressing was typical and decent. But the rest of it wasn't so delightful. First, the peanuts: I love peanuts, and was glad that they weren't salted. But I think they were raw, and they didn't taste right. Not rancid, just unpleasant. The tomatoes and sparse green peppers were diced so tiny that I couldn't even spear them, and they kept falling off the fork.   The worst part was the Chinese noodles. When I was a kid, my mom used to buy Mee Tu Chinese noodles. They were kosher, as we were, which meant we never, ever had real Chinese food. (The story of my "conversion" is a funny one!). They were sold in a can and simply awful - though I didn't think so then, because I didn't know any better. The ones at John Cutter were so reminiscent of Mee Tu, and only slightly fatter and not as crispy. I would have hated to have to pick them out of the salad.   Overall, it was an average meal.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese Chicken Salad, noodles &amp; dressing on the side

th-q4TGtSw-JwtIT5puKVg.text: I have a friend who had been talking of the 1/2 off steaks on Sunday for awhile now. I had a rateSunday off so we decided to give it a shot.  3 of us arrived about 6pm and the place was packed. We had a short wait and were seated at a high top table near the door. No booths available unless we wanted to wait longer, so we took the table. Only issue was that it was cold so it wasn't too pleasant sitting that close to the door.  Our server came by almost right away for our drink orders, which came out quickly. We ordered the queso dip to share and we each ordered a 10oz filet and salads.  The queso dip was good. And they refilled the chips as many times as we requested until the dip was gone. That was nice, some places want to charge extra for that.  Two of us got the house salad while one got the Caesar. I got the house salad with ranch on the side, and it was delicious. I tried the caesar too which was also good. The croutons on that were homemade and fresh. Salads were a good size too. Our filets came out shortly after we finished out salads. They were seasoned well and great cuts of meat for the price. Gotta admit that they weren't quite done as we ordered though, with all being slightly over or under, not enough to make a big deal over it, plus, the taste and quality of the meat made up for that.  We decided to share the chocolate cake for desert. Wow, it was huge! Very rich though. It reminded me of the Pepperidge farms chocolate fudge cake you can get at the grocery store, but a fresher version.  Overall the meal was great. I'd definitely come back for the steak special. We've been to fancier places that served filet that wasn't as good as this, at twice the price. And even though they were crowded, the service was great. We didn't have to ask for refills and plates were taken away promptly. We left full and happy, can't ask for more than that!
