4tVIG2G2KzgtNH6OARwM1w.text: John Cutter is back and is as good as ever!  Taylor was on point with service and the food is fantastic!  I am so happy we came back again!  See you every Sunday !!

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent value!!
Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think JC is back!! Service is excellent again..... Food is on point....

EiyNgArN8_S6ZG1SAstV4w.text: Excellent food , John Cutter is a convenient place to get good food anytime time of the day or evening, waits are short for the most part.

MwZN16ZOPTy9i6Azr3LVcw.text: Good food and a great atmosphere. I enjoy the breakfast menu and the Philly Cheese for dinner. The only issue is consistency. Meaning the same order from time to time doesn't always come out 100% the same as the time before. Overall, a great neighborhood place. You can enjoy a beer, a steak and the game.

L5qlqNJ2czk-wmR_OAdTEw.text: My girl and I FINALLY found our gaming bar! First off I would like to say that Chris on graveyard is the best! Awesome service and friendly! This bar is a little far from where we live but it's totally worth it if Chris is bartending. This place has awesome food, can't wait to try more when we go back! We didn't win anything but you can't win on your first visit right?!? But when we do win we got you Chris! Thank you for your awesome service!

C5GBzzsyflvM4u3PbJXWBg.text: Nice place... nice and friendly wait staff. Maybe a little dark inside.. why not 5 stars? Well,  it's just not exceptional. Solid choice for a good happy hour.

LhCCWCBz-0PsO85xUhAgmQ.text: I am so disappointed! The service was absolutely horrible! I had to get up from the dining table twice to get the waitress "Maria" to replace my meal with the food that I had ordered! When she finally brought my salad it was drenched with so much vinegar and oil that the feta cheese was melting! I paid $16.00 for chicken strips and received 4 the size of my pointer finger! (About 2 inches long) that were supposed to come with salad but she brought fries! I ask for a glass for my beer and she never brought it..I had to get up from the table and go to the bar to get a glass and there was Maria just bullish---ing  with some dude! WOW I will never eat at John Cutter again..it seems John Cutter has gotten greedy and are cutting corners all the way around! From service to the quality/quantity of there food! Very disappointing! What a waste of my hard earned cash! Don't go for Happy Hour the menu has been cut in half!!

iPLd9ve9QACGtEHeQX-HAw.text: Mushy steak! For $35, a bone in rib eye should be juicy, cooked the way you ordered, and taste reasonably good.  This place's food has gone down hill.  My rib eye came out mushy texture with almost an ashy after taste.  It lacked basic seasoning like salt and pepper, but is instead drenched in chilli oil.  While it's a thick cut of meat, it was disgusting and inedible.  It's likely from them not thawing out the steak all the way before cooking.  Husband ordered the salmon dish, same feedback.  Mushy, lack seasoning, and drenched in chili oil.  The best thing is still the French fries and grilled asparagus, but we're not going to be coming back to pay $27-35 to not eat our entrees.

kRHsagmC1adOcc_kdXd3aQ.text: Best deal on Sunday for steaks !! And we love coming here! The steaks are so delicious  will definitely recommend other family and friends!!

5sR0QDMVlaxT9S0F9Dtd7g.text: Cutter's is the best. Enjoy the fresh food and great drinks! Awesome service and they treat you like family.

j24CIvqoDXiUlpsszX-n3g.text: It's True that if a restaurant doesn't acknowledge your presence they don't  deserve your business.  For the second time, we decided to dine at John Cutter in this Thursday evening.  I arrived at 6:25 and noticed that the pub was 3/4 filled.  I found an open table near the bar and pulled up a seat to wait for my date.  As I sat for over 10 minutes waiting for my party, I was not acknowledged by ANYONE on the staff.  Nada.  Five minutes later my date arrived and I motioned that I didn't care to stay here.  We left, still with no one acknowledging us and went next door (Al's Garage) where we were greeted IMMEDIATELY and with a smile!  It will be a long while before I elect to visit John Cutter.

P0zkn8CF0HtLHSVStqJ3fw.text: Chris and Kim have a chemistry with their guest that is unteachable. Paired with an incredible culinary presentation, their hospitality make this place a blast of fresh air. You need to be here!

UZmfj6AwSM_7H_TqEbSV3w.text: I found little to like about John Cutter. The waitress was pleasant at first but she never did understand that we wanted TWO steak and cheese sandwiches with extra plates. We ordered two medium rare hamburgers that came out beyond well done.  The sides with all of these were supposed to be Caesar Salad.  Although the restaurant was sparsely populated when we got there, our orders took about 40 minutes to be delivered, some of which time was spent with the orders sitting under heat lamps.  When we finally got the food, we found the salad and pickles had been brought to warm by the heat lamps.   So we ended up eating overcooked hamburgers that had ingredients other than what we specifically ordered.  The steak and cheese was dismal and didn't even look right.  The salad was inadvertently cooked by the heat lamp and limp.    When we mentioned this to our server, she explained that there were only two waitresses there as if that explained everything.  This is a restaurant we will avoid.

najh-r6z29dXahfxijsvIw.text: Been looking for a neighborhood restaurant with good food and reasonable prices. This place ain't it! Ordered a HUGE burger and a Philly cheesesteak.  Guys, when 2 sandwiches cost $27, I'd expect a really good sandwich.  Burger was big but tasteless, and a Philly cheesesteak has onions, peppers, cheese, and sometimes mushrooms, not a few burned onions and a styrofoam container of runny Velveeta!  Especially for $15!  It's a sandwich of last nights leftovers for goodness sake! Barmaids were fabulous, bubbly and sweet. Look, you are not a destination and your prices are WAY high for the quality you are serving.  No one is coming back unless the food is good.  So far, you're 1 for 2 on that score...   Oh, next time please wrap the pickle instead of just throwing it in the bottom of the box with the sandwich and fries.  It ruins the fries!

myxQa0pOAmcmT42e2OyAuw.text: Yes I understand this is a bar disguised as a restaurant  / bar. The waitresses were not so friendly from the start. Probably because I had 3 small children in my group.  I found this place because of groupon. We were trying to get settled and decide on what to eat the waitress stopped at least 3 times, it seemed more of a rush than attentiveness.  Prices were high but I couldn't decide if they were appropriate until we tried the food. The food was horrible, stale chips for the nachos, guacamole was brown on top. A tiny bit of meat. The chicken strips were $14 and came with fries. It was like 4 chicken strips and a handful of fries. The chicken was barely cooked and room temp in the center at best. The quesidilla was good but dry. "We don't have salsa"  I could go on but I think I've made point.. It is highly unlikely that I will return. Incase I didn't mention it the waitresses were not very nice.

c4u3EgG_aLHxvHcCgMnFDw.text: This place is pack.. Great deal on Sunday.. Half off steaks on Sunday.. Awesome outdoor seating.. Nice cool chill place to have a few bites and cocktails..

5-__x6d3xYhC_JUOv1CaAg.text: Heather is absolutely the best. I am a regular every Sunday for there steak special, which I've yet to find a place that can top them. Just in case you live in a cave .. Every Sunday all day Sunday Cutter's offers 50% off steaks. I can ensure you that this isn't one of those dive bars that use low quality steak to make ends meet with there Sunday special. There steak is absolutely amazing . If you come on a Friday or Saturday night there is always live music going on in the center of the courtyard. I've never had bad service there and would recommend this place to everyone as a must try. Also you have to save room for desert .Best carrot cake in town hands down!

uWaWsd7DklyCw9IrsdGaVA.text: Absolutely awful service!! My mom and I just went for a late night dinner and no one came to our table. The place was empty so I thought maybe you had to dine at the bar. I asked the bartender if we order with her and she said, "oh yeah I can take your order, I see you" then when she came she rudely asked if we wanted something to drink and when she brought our waters she walked away immediately. There was NO ONE in there. HORRIBLE. I suggest the owner reevaluates his staff because I work in the restaurant industry and I can understand certain situations but jeez that service was the worst. Lol comical.

OUzmdlfN9Qf7H0fUE_8VOg.text: UPDATE:  sent an email to Kristy Morrison, General Manager over a week ago and received NO ACKNOWLEDGEMENT---speaks volumes to the service we received...  ...my first experience with this venue was this evening, Sunday, which is 1/2 price steak night.  Understandably, the venue was packed.  NOT understandably was the fact that 2/3 of the food we ordered never came, including one of our steaks! The potatoes arrived after the steaks that did manage to find their way to our table but the salad, along with a steak and the asparagus sadly must have been lost in transit.  When we attempted to voice our concerns to the manager, (after having asked to speak with her multiple times) she finally arrived at our table immediately ordering one of our party to calm down and another to sit down ( he had simply gotten up to go look for her at the same time she was arriving) and advised that she had already heard our complaint from the server and wasn't interested in hearing it again.  She offered to remove the items not received from the bill (seriously? Does this not fall under the category of 'duh'?) and offered a gift certificate for the inconvenience of the inconsistent service. Not surprisingly, we never received the gift certificate. She then attempted to discount the incredibly unacceptable service by indicating a full house and new staff. Young lady, Management 101: YOUR staffing issues are NOT the problem of your patrons; accept accountability and attempt to accommodate your clientele with respect and dignity. The only reason I gave this venue 1 star is so that my review would be posted. If enough patrons complain about the abysmal service this venue obviously considers acceptable, perhaps actual management will review its process and make some adjustments. Not holding my breath...and I WILL be calling in the morning to report the incredibly disrespectful manner in which this obviously unskilled manager spoke to the 80 year old gentleman at our table. There is a plethora of amazing steak houses in Las Vegas; there is NO NEED to patronize this one.

DBvkHnQCiW8vIvJfw_ELXw.text: This is our 3rs time and perhaps last. We were excited that they serve breakfast. Today my wife and I came here after a long walk so we can eat our favorite breakfast without guilt. I ordered filet omelet all egg white and my wife ordered the JC omelet. After 15 minutes our food arrived to a big disappointment. Not sure where they found their cook as the omelet had a broken runny egg with no presentation. When asked the server what happened as this was supposed to be an omelet, she replied that's how they make it as the egg white can not hold the ingredients. Wow I said. I asked her that perhaps your cook needs to go back to cooking school. My wife's JC omelet was substandard as the mushrooms appeared to be canned mushrooms with a thin layer of eggs.. The overall quality and tastes is not acceptable. I have to say that the young lady server did her best to accommodate. Prices are spot on but if you don't get what you order, even free is expensive.

xbB_MMHwWkawKT35prxnIw.text: No draft beer is a drag.  I like the $6 burger Tuesday lunch special.  The house salad is good too.  The waitresses are nice to look at but it is hit or miss with service.  I go about once a week but they never seem to remember me; interesting for a neighborhood grill.  I have been a few times on Sunday during football season.  A great steak and side for $13...cannot beat that!

91EHeEkG6bdIPsZUktE_HA.text: The food is okay. Had Queso and chips, Caesar salad, Filet and Lobster tail.  The Queso was excellent, and the Caesar salad was mediocre if you like lots of bitter lettuce drenched in low end dressing with tasteless parmesan. I cannot comment on the Filet or Lobster because after 2hrs I cancelled the order.  FOODIE BEWARE! Abhorrent service and management! What a joke! Can see the potential but the current version, NO THANKS!

cdnwx-tfC8UbX-_UCl0vTA.text: Came here for the first time in years. Tonight my fiance and I had the chicken wings off the appetizer which was terrific and got phillycheese steak. Let me tell you that was gone in minutes! Much better food than I had remembered and we will definitely be back again soon!

ZA2YB855DHEvgw7T-FbBwQ.text: After a year I decided to give this place another shot. Fail! Went in and "waited to be seated" close to 5 minutes. Finally someone came to greet us only to say, "the hostess will be right with you." Ugh! With less than 20 people in the establishment is it so hard for someone  to take on the  hostess responsubility for the sake of engaging with a new customer in under 10 minutes from the time they walk in the door? #restaurantrescue.

7I4d2H78biLV6ovpuUtWuA.text: I went today, filled with apprehension based on the scathing reviews of the service here, but received very attentive and charming service from Taylor.  The food was generally good - I enjoyed the much-vaunted Philly Steak Fries, and ordered a Chicken Marsala, which proved to be an enormous pasta dish, not a piece of chicken with pasta on the side, as I was expecting.  Nonetheless, it was tasty, though the pasta were somewhat overcooked.  My partner ordered the Fettucine, which he enjoyed thoroughly.  It's quite pricey and a bit noisy for a neighborhood restaurant, which is why I'm taking off a star, but I think we'll be back.  It's nice to have a place like this in the neighborhood, and I wish them well.

REzVCiWajyHjIdttXKtkrw.text: Overpriced meh food.  Bad service. They had a groupon where they weren't upfront that it was only available for, like, a three hour window M-Th. It didn't say that anywhere in the groupon. I think they just didn't want to honor it.    That would have been nice to know when we first sat down and told the hostess, "hey, we have a groupon." Instead, she said "great!" Then, we had a $40 lunch that consisted of two burgers and were stuck paying full price for mediocre cold burgers.  This place is like a wannabe hooters. The entire time we were here, there were three or four scantily clad ladies behind the bar giving each other backrubs. Gross.

I0WRucoFM69omkz_KAkqwA.text: 6 of us came in and had a table in no time. We were greeted by our waitress right away and orders for drinks were taken. The menu is typical of a small pub, but I had been told of their Surf and turf special of steak and lobster tail. I had that on my mind as orders were placed. Myself and my buddy ordered the same meal, both ordering our steaks medium rare. 20-25 minutes later our meals for 5 in our party was brought out. My wife didn't receive her dinner of steak and potato. Mine and my buddies steak was crisp, and so over cooked it was dry and stiff. Our Lobster tails were extremely small (2oz) and straight up cold and rubbery. We asked for our meals to be redone and our waitress finally sent them back. Meanwhile we sit there and wait. About 10 minutes later we receive our plates back, but no lobster. Just a steak on the plate.  WTH!! This whole time, my wife has NEVER had her meal brought to the table! Complete BS and I told the waitress and she said she couldn't get it from the kitchen?! I'm pissed and told her so. Finally after everyone is almost done, my wife's steak is brought to the table. She liked it and was finally happy. Because the Saturday special of Lobster and steak comes with no sides for $19 I paid that price for just a steak. Once it was brought to the table, yes it was indeed good, but damn! So many missed opportunities to have this a good meal.  I can't ever see coming back to this place, as there are so many other places in Las Vegas that have better food and quality service and actually care about the consumers experience.

NoKbz3g-rz3Sn4ajmYYX1g.text: To start with, be aware that the online menu is wrong. The price for a 18oz Rib Eye is not $24.00, it's $32.00. Big difference  than the price expected. My wife and I ordered 2 rib eye's to be cooked rare to medium rare. They were cooked medium well and medium well to well done. Very disappointed in that. The steak had great flavor. The service was fair. Not very attentive. All in all not really happy about my first time at John Cutter but will go back and make sure that I order a raw to rare steak and that way I can send back to cook a little more if necessary. The salad which is not included was excellent

DtHJRxlVmDGSTTSFMAYoyg.text: Decent atmosphere, but interior is very crowded with the table spacing.  It was not crowded when we were there, but I can imagine with a full load, it would be tough to move around.  Food was decent, but nothing spectacular.  I had a burger; my wife had chicken marsala, which was more like pasta with a couple chunks of marsala-flavored chicken.  Prices a bit high, but somewhat expected for this part of town.  Service was very good, however: attentive and friendly.  Staff split a Caesar salad and an entree for another couple without additional upcharge, which was nice.  Short answer: I would return if I were close by, but would not drive very far to get here.

2cy0J4NMQVneOVZ3dfkMng.text: I might not be the best person to rate and overall John Cutters experience as I've only been here a couple times late at night and each time I ordered the steak wrap or chicken wrap with the steak wrap being the best of the two. Packed to the gills with finely chopped well seasoned steak. Since its been a late night stop its never been crowded so service was good. I like the decor but does seem a bit cramped but this I'm sure to take advantage of a relatively small bar. I guess I need to come on in here and give it a real good test during a busier time and order up a steak and really put John's to the test. But for this review I'd give John Cutters a solid 4 stars for a good late night neighborhood stop.

kzjVL_qOeYmmjJr-WsPiWQ.text: First time and loved it!! It was awesome. Most of the staff was really nice. Nice atmosphere! The food was amazing. We love a good steak and whoever was back there cooking won the prize! Holy cow! The cheese sauce on the Philly cheesesteak...I could just eat that...lol. Sooooo good! We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot cake! Up yeah...huge...delicious...sharable.
Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly cheese steak fries! Holy cow!! This is the half portion and my hubby and I were able to share as an appetizer.
Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye was perfection!

gK3hmogyYeaQuxK3_fryjg.text: Hehe, Hooters in the Burbs.  I read another review stating this and I couldn't agree more, except the waitresses at a real Hooters are usually much more fun.  I live around the corner and yet I rarely go because of this factor.  I've only ever been with my husband and we would both much sooner drive down the road to Red Rock.    The food is hit or miss.  The drinks are expensive.  I am giving this two stars instead of one because the last time I went the sandwich I ordered was pretty good and the waitress was actually very friendly.  Maybe they're turning things around.

no9ZCYu93QdBRoOHHwSypQ.text: Awesome Experience - Again! It's been a while since our first visit and John Cutter's is a drive from our house. We had a Groupon. Greeting was friendly and warm from the bartender. Our server (Blondie) arrived with menus and announced it was Happy Hour, except that Groupon did not cover HH items - fair enough. Hubby ordered the Philly Steak Sandwich (in fairness it could have used more cheese), I got the Wings - hot w/ salad. Both portions more than ample and freshly prepared. I must say I loved my side salad. I really appreciate when a restaurant goes out of their way to make a nice side salad (Spring mix, diced cukes, halved grape tomatoes, pine nuts and feta). I focused on that knowing I could take the wings home. Blondie was very attentive throughout our meal and all of the staff thanked us as we departed. They were decorating for Halloween festivities.There are alot of great choices on the menu, we both agreed - we're looking forward to our next visit. Thank you!!....so funny, I just saw last month a review with said there was too much cheese on the Philly Steak Sandwich, don't listen. Like my husband said. I got a plate and napkins, it's a 'cheese' steak, I expect it to be a little messy and I'm prepared for it.....go back to the old way if there was not old way :D

7aUDseTDT42CNb7O2POnvQ.text: Had a groupon decided to check it out, steak was good, server was lacking. It was busy and loud which wasn't bad but it was our first time there, so we weren't familiar withthe menu. Some of us had steak and some had salmon. The salmon came with sides and the steak did not. I wish the server would have told us more about the menu or asked if we wan't sides. The server checked in once and never offered anyone a refill of their drinks.  It felt like they were put out by the groupon and didn't want to deal with us. Prob won't return.

pET8kIhQW8cxyqx_gedOnw.text: Great little restaurant we always go to on our way back from hiking at Red Rock.  Lots of TV's to watch sports, nice ambiance and delicious food.  I usually get one of their salads which are all delicious and big. My BF gets a burger and fries and loves it.  Sunday is 1/2 off steak day-- i don't think i'll ever order anything else their NY steak is soo good!  It comes with a large salad and was perfectly cooked.  Me and my bf brought home the leftovers and ate it for dinner.  Huge yummy steak at $13 bucks since it was 1/2 off... we'll be back after our next hike!

q9tgg_MxYv7JqBBMiYbDeg.text: Well first off let me start by sayin i hang out here quite a bit so my review may be biased in the form of the staff, but my food review will be more of an accurate nature i presume.. I personally love the atmosphere of the place and find it to be a great all around place to go for lunch,dinner or just having drinks at the bar or hangin on the patio.. All the girls that work there are awesome and do their jobs well.. They got a lot of heat for it being all girls that work there but whatever, they make it work well.. Now for the food.. The menu recently changed and i haven't had everything on it yet but what i have had i have enjoyed, the real hallmark of the place is their staeks and on Sunday they have them half price, which is well worth every penny u pay.. The salads are good and i enjoy the caesar there quite often with chicken or without and i have yet to be dissapointed.. On Tuesdays they have huge burgers for half price that come with fries and it is a huge meal and they are very good..!!  The happy hour is better than it used to be and all in all the place is a fun bar/restaraunt with really good food and a great vibe with good people hangin around.. The gambling is good and i see people winning all the time, so do yourself a favor and give this place a try asap..!!!

nJHUBI0T_0SMkbItYoh86w.text: My girlfriend and I decided to try this place out because of the cute patio and some of the people's food looked pretty good- especially the fries.  I stood at the podium for almost ten minutes waiting for someone to acknowledge me.  Finally a waitress had to walk outside to check on her tables and she greeted me and gave me two menus.  She ended up giving my friend and I good service but that start almost had me give up and leave.  I wanted iced tea but weirdly they had none made that day.  On a beautiful day out?  Kind of strange.  My friend ordered a chicken wrap that had avocado in it and a side of fries, and I ordered wings and blue cheese that apparently also came with a side of fries or a salad, and I ordered shrimp tacos.  My friend ate all of her wrap and we shared her fries.  I liked the texture of the fries- they weren't too skinny and had some of the potato peel still on them.  The fries were hearty if that helps describe them.  The wings were good but way too salty.  I had to use the blue cheese to help drown out the salty-ness.  The wings actually seemed like they added pepper to try to calm the salt but it just was not working for me.  Don't order the wings here.  I ended up getting salad with the wings and we asked for ranch on the side of the salad.  We ended up getting ranch with the salad at no charge, but the salad came with some kind of house dressing on it.  I didn't complain but I also did not eat the salad.  I didn't particularly care for the dressing or the cheese bits in the salad so I picked at three cucumbers in it and left the rest.  My shrimp tacos was a very large order of three tacos.  I requested avocado in them which I am glad I did.  The sides with the tacos were a pico, a refried bean dip and Spanish rice.  The sides were okay.  The rice was a tad bland but still okay.  The shrimp in my tacos were shriveled (over-cooked) and also very salty.  This place loves salt I guess!  Total bill with 20 percent tip was $50 for two girls (two entrees and one appetizer.)  Not too awful but probably won't go back unless I just want fries.  It just wasn't an impressive place.

qfjOkXGgVTGhC2Kc_IYhCg.text: Stopped in for lunch on a Saturday.   Since my wife and I were bringing the baby, I called ahead to make sure they had a smoke free eating area and that they had high chairs.   I was told yes to both.      Well, they had high chairs, but the inside is all just one room, containing tables, bar, and gaming.   i guess smoking isn't allowed, but I didn't think it was an ideal family eating environment.      We ended up eating outside, even though it was a bit cool out.   Food was mixed.   My wife did not at all like the meat on her chinese chicken salad, saying it was tasteless and reminded her of fish somehow.   But, she liked the rest of the salad.   My grilled chicken sandwich was good, though the menu should have mentioned that it came with avocado and cheese; it wasn't a problem for me, but might be for some people.   French fries (thick) were hot and fresh.   i would have liked to try the cheesesteak, but the fact that it was made with cheddar instead of provolone scared me off since it made it seem inauthentic.      I probably would give it another try, but not with a child.

o8mIrsFScjdmZYo6YOx5Cw.text: i've been here 3 times now, but i only come here on sundays to get the 1/2 off any steaks which is really good. i recommend the 18oz bone in rib eye cooked to your request.

Gm2efqx-dYhy1k_M2yWFdQ.text: After being very hungry from a day of climbing, we thought we'd try John Cutter.  It was a medium volume night, and our service was slow, the food was good but not spectacular, and the prices were high.  Even for Vegas standards.  I've never written a review before, but our experience was so lousy that It inspired me.  Go to the Italian or Chinese place right beside John Cutter.

dvqx_1xi7-7bkIXmf5YaJw.text: How can you not love this place. They have the BEST STEAKS in Summerlin and in the TOP 10 BEST Steaks in Vegas.. and on half off Steak Sundays this is THE PLACE to be!! and they also serve their version of the WORLD FAMOUS PRIMANTIS Sandwhich which as far as I know they are the ONLY ones on the West Coast to do this... and its GREAT!!.. I love the staff...I love the drinks.. and I love hanging out here whenever I am in Vegas. Give it a shot!

Qi1shOyJhbgt6I2xcP9Q3g.text: I have been to John Cutter's several times, usually take-out.  I love their steaks, cheeseburgars and salad's.  The staff has always been fast and friendly!!!

f9kC89vDQ6WmcKZTeVWluw.text: I went to this establishment on one the TapOut promotional events. The food and drinks were moderately priced and the portions were plentiful. The service was pleasant and attentive but it was a Thursday night. The happy hour beer and sliders promotion needs a couple more additions. Good place for cold beer after hiking at red rock.

ko1Ym5Yerflg2txVrVdKjA.text: WOW!!!! I can't believe the who they let work there. I went in to get a few drinks and some food with some buddies. The waitress, Sarah Y, and the bartender (didn't get her name) were down right rude, vulgar, and just plain awful human beings! Unprofessional does not come anywhere close to it , and not only will I never go back as long as those two twenty something double digit I.Q. twits work there, I will make sure the large groups of friend I go there with stay away. The food is good the beer is cold, but the staff thinks its okay to scream mother F****er with kids eating a few tables away!!! Mentioning it to them not only upsets them, but get you COMPLETELY ignored, along with vulgar four letter mumbles clearly become directed at you from behind the bar. I seriously can't believe the experience there, it was truly unbelievable. For the sake of sane, decent, normal people everywhere AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!!!

Yol0MRVM6a97j9MxAdxx6A.text: The food is fantastic!  Smiley and very friendly service.  The pricing is on the high side, but the food is worth the splurge.  They do have a great deal on Sundays... 1/2 off steaks comes with a really nice side salad.  I recommend it!

vdn_IAhW-mqsNlCxVQ-HMw.text: Great bar.  Great hang out spot and food is constantly good. Try the steak nachos

ROTIIGHj4G-u7NzWt2e_bA.text: The service staff is very nice and pretty cute!  But it's the food that has brought me back quite a bit.  Plus it's smoke-free.  ALERT!!  THEY HAVE THE BEST PHILLY CHEESESTEAK IN TOWN!!  I've also had the primanti-style steak sandwich and burger there.  The steak sandwich was another excellent choice.  The burger left something to be desired...it was not cooked how I wanted it and was average.  The prices are on the higher end but managable...

Ip2alDEpGxFbAidGN7wRtw.text: I personally love John Cutter!!! I think it is a great friendly neighborhood restaurant. Portions are HUGE so the prices are great for the amount of food you get. They also recently started doing half portions of items at a smaller price. I have not tried one bad thing on the the menu. All the employees are so nice as well... I am so glad a place like this came into the area. Another great thing, they are now doing breakfast on the weekends!!! Big portions as well. It's nice to have some where to get a real breakfast close by, not a doughnut...  I highly reccommend going in. They know what they are doing ;-)

1TjJFZ39PUU7YhHtCDkDTQ.text: Great food...great personality.  Wish they had a couple of more TV's for sports.  Would definately recommend as a great place to socialize.

Nuho28nSmf1R07rjJnNQLw.text: We went for their 2nd anniversary last week and had a great time. The place was packed. Had a band playing and giving out gifts and t-shirts. Even though it was so busy, the waitresses did a great job. Food was quick and also very good. I finally had the sirloin steak and lobster and it was very good.

BtVNOscsPtiNMzhMKzDv2g.text: I actually live in the neighborhood and it took me a while to visit this restaurant. It seemed more like a bar than a place for good food. But I'm glad I decided to try it. Yes, the food is expensive but I think it is worth the occasional splurge. It hands down beats any other food options in that small shopping center. The portion are good-sized. As someone else pointed out - the atmosphere is not kid-friendly. I took my 3-year-old and infant daughter for breakfast... and even then... it's too adult. But, I tell ya, I'm looking forward to a night when my husband and I can get a babysitter and eat and drink ourselves silly. We can then stumble home with full, happy bellies.

SKho4fnCwX7dnozX4orRfQ.text: Great burgers, Sunday night '1/2 off steaks' is pretty sweet too! Don't miss out on the glorious carrot cake, best in town!

sTvtADc3jo8bA8Sy6KFk9A.text: This place is no doubt a diamond in the rough, comfortable, family friendly, delectable food, and great service. Yes we will be coming back often and so close to our place.

PW4E5_gNzCpN-i2XLV2VKw.text: Came for Sunday half-price steak night, which is the only time I will come from now on. The steak salad that I ordered was delicious, as usual.  The service was a little better tonight, although they forgot my father-in-law's meal and looked entirely confused. They receive an additional star because our service was sweet and actually acted like she cared about serving us, unlike most of the servers/bartender at this establishment.

ODA77eRvGjf53AGouhP7og.text: I can't believe some of the bad reviews I've been reading, from crazy customers sending back all their steaks and walking out on the check on steak night to former employees posting their grievances. I've been coming to Cutters for the past 3 years and I've never experienced any of that. The owner (Adam) has always been very respectful and gracious when I see him and I've never had a bad steak yet! I don't know what it's like to work there, but this is obvious not the forum for a disgruntled employee to post her grievances. When I go to Yelp I'm looking for reviews on the food, service and cleanliness of the place.  I must say the food is pretty awesome, I love the burger Tuesday's and steak Sunday food specials, but the chicken wrap w/ avocado is my favorite! I can agree with some of the other reviews that a couple of the waitresses need better training and when the place is busy the service does suffer. Overall this is a great neighborhood bar with great food specials and friendly service.

FtLoqMXO7xeutysS_HGvOg.text: I love this place. Close to home and the $6 burgers on Tuesday are great but the half off steaks on Sundays are even better. The menu has a good variety of things to choose from that is not just bar food. JC Salad is always a safe go to.   The staff is nice a make this place have a Cheers type atmosphere, its AWESOME!!  And they have outside seating with is perfect if you have a dog and want to bring them along. MY pups Love their burgers on Tuesday night :-D

a04OXw2lSCKWwAGI_ffaYw.text: If I could give this place no stars rating I would.   We came here for a friends birthday dinner, there were 16 of us. To keep this review short, there was a hair in my nachos, and we had a person in our party leave because he never got ANYTHING that he ordered. We already finished our meals before he could even get his water. (He waited over an hour)   The general manager said they were confused with the orders because we had all the bills split.   Our other friend left pissed because he also never got his food and they still gave him a bill.  The general manager was making excuse after excuse for their horrible service.   They messed up the bills, charges cards incorrectly and the excuse was "I was never given instructions on splitting the cards"  Never returning.   The food was okay but not justifiable to the service.

NE7i8LhvmztHMF0WL0oi7A.text: If I could give zero stars I would. I have never been so blatantly lied to before. I understand that on sundays it's a half price steak special and it's a great deal, but when you order a steak and it's completely over cooked it's not out of line to ask for a new one whether you're paying $32 or $16. I ordered a New York steak medium and my girlfriend ordered a filet medium. Her steak came out perfectly pink throughout, mine was grey all the way through. So I told the waitress I ordered it medium and she said "well I see a little bit of pink so it is medium". Then the manager came over and said "you ordered a medium and this is how we do mediums here, and it's 45 min out for a steak". We told him my girlfriend ordered it cooked the same way and there's a night and day difference between the two, to which he had nothing to say.  I understand that when it's busy it's inconvenient to cook a new steak, but to lie to my face is very disrespectful. Which I'm sure he realized he knew he was doing when my girlfriend showed him her steak.  The inconsistency in the kitchen and the disrespectful service from the manager is not worth the savings. Spend the extra money on a restaurant that actually knows how to cook a steak.

cdIBD87gLSq3X8uqzvYw-w.text: If you're looking for a restaurant that has great steak and terrible service, this would be your spot. I have dined at JC's twice and attempted a third hoping that it would at some point get better...it did not. In fact it was progressively worse.  The first time I dined with them the server was plenty nice but lacked attention to our table. The steak was good.  The second visit took us no time to sit but about 15 minutes for our waitresses to even acknowledge our presence. After taking our order, the next time we saw our waitresses was 45 minutes later. She delivered our food and realized she never brought over any drinks.  The last attempt, we walked in and waited at the inconvenient and awkwardly position empty hostess station. We had several of the staff walk past without even a "we'll be right with you." After 10 minutes of that...we called it a wrap for John Cutter.

IzSeBINQxtPvXsoKPLJOAg.text: I got what I deserved for not listening to the last few reviews, the service was not great, I got sent from the hostess to the bar back to a hostess just to get my food I ordered to go, which was not that tasty. I ordered the Philly fries it tasted like I could've made A better version at home. I was sure to taste of meat before I poured the cheese on there and it was not flavorful. I think they need to start with better management. There needs to be a designated pick up area that all the employees know about. Even when I have OK food I still return to restaurants that give great service. The bar tender continued to count her drawer as she yelled across to the hostess to grab my food, not too professional for a nice looking place like that.

gRS131fKpRcBB6ll0aqByg.text: Terrible service. Ordered the Cobb salad minus tomatoes and blue cheese. When it was delivered there were tomatoes and when I pointed it out the server said they would correct it. She brought the same salad back a few minutes later in disarray, they just picked out the tomatoes instead of making a new salad. I ask for ranch in the side and she told me they were out but didn't offer any alternatives. Who runs out of ranch dressing, especially when your restaurant is in the parking lot of a grocery store!  Will NEVER go back.

Ll4arULkVXyqSdY1yuWAeA.text: This place is amazing! The food is great. I love the chicken philly fries. They have a house cheese sauce that is so good. My husband loves going on Sundays for half priced steaks.

photos.caption: Photo of John Cutter - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Philly Fries! Delicious!

2tKDn9kuQaRt0J_ze95WDg.text: I had been to this restaurant a few times in the past with mixed results...subpar service and average food. However the last two times the service has been quite good and the food has been super. I especially enjoy their Red Rock Cobb Salad. It is excellent. I think the key is to get there early to beat the crowd... better service and less noise.

THsYqqkIRtCJWZtHhHs08Q.text: Friendly staff. Food was pretty good. Fridays are half off ribs. I tried the ribs and a side of steamed veggies. The sauce was a little sweet so I didn't finish the ribs but I would get it again with the sauce on the side. The blueberry lemonade was good - they're not skimpy on the liquor which is always a positive. The menu had a lot of nice choices and it looks like a meal with appetizers will run about $30 on an average day. There's a late afternoon and late night happy hour. Nice atmosphere with large bar area and outdoor seating. I'd go back

DTlhDH25XVZJ2-y81zntQA.text: Used to come here for the half off steaks because the filet was so good. Stopped coming because the restaurant is just too cramped for the amount of people that come in. (Not just on steak night.) the waitresses seem to be hired more on looks and not on skill. This restaurant gets so busy, and when it does...the service is horribly slow. The only thing I get from here is the tasty steak. Not a fan of anything else I've tried. Happy this place gets a lot of business, not happy when I'm the one waiting an hour for food in an overly crowded restaurant.

htUfOrdtQQxFIRKe8mNgqw.text: Great service. Cate is awesome and understands my love for the philly fries. Keep on being awesome :)

krrL5Na491Jsq0fW4g4I0g.text: A group of us went after a hike at Red Rock - the service was fine, the food was good, not sure what all the complaining is about.   I had the chicken wrap and French fries, the fries were hot and delicious, the wrap was loaded with chicken and avocado, it was good! 2 of our group had the burger, it was huge and reportedly tasted good too.   Overall, the only complaint was the iced tea was weak, but the server brought replacement drinks immediately. I'd go back!

VyrykJ8bytprPOh1M9VLKA.text: Love their wings & ranch is great! Talked to the chef and his name is fernando great cook. Love the Christmas upside down theme lol

h-hP1-Xr2qx02ywVlISWeQ.text: Just had their Saturday special Surf & Turf for $19 can't beat that, so good!! Great little tavern open 24 hours and service is great too!

2ZEw8NZk18ecFhGytHglLw.text: The food was generally average as far as bar food is concerned but the service, especially the kitchen speed, is well below par.  I will say that we were there for lunch on Father's day but they were not overwhelmingly busy.  Checks came out way out of order and other customers were also audibly upset with the slowness of the kitchen,  45 minutes for chicken nuggets, steak and eggs a wrap and a philly is WAY too long, even if you are busy.  The "OOOpps sorry bout that " wait staff with no skills in dealing with customer complaints is why I won't be back.

Mfjr1gHPzRaw5cOBK_BC-w.text: I have eaten here with 4 or 5 friends every Tuesday and Sunday night pretty religiously. The place used to be great. But over the course of our last 5 tries s the food has been horrible. Multiple items returned on multiple trips by multiple people in the group. I mean one night a burger was sent back 3 times from one person. The cooks CAN NOT cook meat. I have yet to receive a properly cooked steak. Medium arrives with no pink. Medium rare arrives rare. I give up. Last night was the end we all agreed cutters is off the routine. 3 of 5 of us are all in the restaurant business and all are pretty accustomed to mistakes. But this is just ridiculous. We can only imagine the food being wasted in this kitchen as we know we are not the only ones sending food back. On several occasions we have seen quiet a few orders headed back. I'm giving them 2 stars because there servers. Mary, heather, and Taylor. Are great girls with great personalities. But the rest is in need of serious repairs. Bye John Cutters.

L4_6ctbmRmkKG_zwkTDR0g.text: I have been to John Cutter's many times and it is definitely one of my favorite steak places. The food is magnificent and the workers are delightful. Although every time I go for dinner I ask for Vanessa! She is by far my favorite waitress. She is friendly, funny, and a very good waitress! I definitely recommend this restaurant!

ZqdIo2UiWfpWWRygJKty1A.text: Awful service. Mediocre food. This place is okay for dinner but for breakfast/brunch it's awful. Coffee wasn't ready and took 20 minutes to brew. If you don't make it and you know it takes that long to brew then don't open in the morning. Or offer your customer a concession rather than charging $2.50 for a single cup of coffee because that's how long it took to get it. We aren't at Starbucks! The rude and slow service was the icing on the cake.

fsfOeq2tXovNJJHuauMxWg.text: This place is tiny! And there's often a wait.  But the food is really good! My very favorite thing is Fettuccini Alfredo with Filet Mignon Medallions. It's hard for me to get anything else there it's so good.  They have some amazing "day of the week" specials. For example, Sunday is half price on steaks! No kidding! What a deal! And on tuesdays is $6 burgers.

7qHf23gGkUWUmvick41qug.text: We enjoyed our lunch here. With a coupon, the wife and I stopped by while running errands. I had the 10oz burger with nothing fancy, well, except bacon. It was fantastic. The missus had the Red Rock Cobb Salad. We arrived to a semi packed place (mid-afternoon on a weekend). Although almost full, we got a booth near the front door. The decor is 'sports bar' with booths and bar tables with high chairs. The servers go for short shorts and tshirts. The place was hoppin'. Our server was friendly and quick - even with the crowd. She kept tabs on us throughout our meal and we never lacked for service. We ordered our food and it came out in the normal time frame. The burger was cooked as I had asked and was one tasty burger. The missus enjoyed her salad and even got to take some home for a snack later. This is a place worth the drive out (if you don't live in Summerlin) or stopping by (if you do). Prices are a tick high, but not wallet busting - maybe a buck or two higher. John Cutter is on our list of places we can go to if we're on that side of the valley. tripadvisor.com/ShowUser...

AJbvHrK-WwEkSM2f_b4xXQ.text: Let me just say one thing CHEESE STEAK FRIES ! These are a must and a full size order is huge the white cheese sauce caramelized onions and mushrooms smothered over crispy steak fries and the a generous portion of thinly sliced steak to finish them off wow I would have been great with just a plate of those .  For dinner I went with their 10oz burger with all their toppings I added some avocado for an extra charge . Our waitress was good she was full of energy and attentive without over doing it. She asked me how I wanted my burger cooked I said rare and it actually came out that way . I know that sounds crazy but there are very few places who still cook things rare and they nailed it .   Very pleased they also make a good drink and had a pretty good beer selection as well I would defiantly go back here again great first meal on this new year trip thank you !

OfESSgeN2g9Bje2qMuWoZA.text: Best Ribeye in vegas off the strip! Sunday half off is a great deal. The wait was shorter than expected. The place was small but well worth it because that ribeye was to die for! Great music and our server was awesome! We will definitely be coming back.

Cz5LLcy7aTLyYLRCNl8v-w.text: I came in with a large party of 9,  There was a promotion for signing up for their text alerts. In return we each would receive a free drink. I asked two different servers if it works for everyone, they said yes over 21.  We all ordered appetizers, steaks, and drinks.  We had all signed up. We each received a text saying "free drink" basically. Nothing about any restrictions anywhere on the menu or website or promotion. The server decided to only allow one coupon per table. We had two tables and a large group of 9. This was the worst scam/sketchy ordeal I have faced for a restaurant. Seems like they are money orientated and not customer satisfaction orientated.   All of the meats we received were over cooked. My rare turned out to be medium well.   I would stay away and not come back. Good luck to everyone else.

1hJF7vI3rZHwm9JhXRVo-g.text: This place is a great for its Tuesday $6 cheeseburger special. A HUGE  cheeseburger with fries or house salad for half off, and you can't beat it! The servers are nice n friendly too and it has become a regular for us. You can actually cut the burger in half and still be full (did I mention it's a big burger?) The Philly cheesesteak fries and the Filet nachos are worth a try too. I understand they have a good breakfast too but haven't tried that yet.

VyHBpr1pQuHt0JLrbyt9nQ.text: This is our usual go to spot after hiking Red Rock and I have also walked with my dogs to eat on the patio.  Until this past Sunday I had only had the basics, wraps, burgers, etc.  Basic bar food and drinks.  Nothing amazing but good and the staff is always friendly.   I am always a fan of a place that provides water to my fur babies.   Now, this past Sunday is what made it 4 stars for me.  Their half off steak special!  I mean you can't beat bone in rib eye and a large salad for about $15.   Make sure and sign up for their text coupons as they seem to send them about once a week.

obKPzxiWk8aP5VVXb1W8zg.text: Went with my kids-not ideal. If you are a family, woman or not a single man or group of men, and as a mother of two kids I fit into neither of the latter, forget it. The owner saunters in with his kids and the waitresses (did not see one waiter) who are chosen for their "dimensions" suddenly are on their best behavior. Our waitress was actually waiting on a table of friends of hers and would come to the table with shots and serve AND TAKE ONE with her "friends" group. Our service was terrible, the food wasn't bad, actually decent, but the service and atmosphere are just not worth it.

E5jkij-2_hqJ0haodRgsqQ.text: We haven't been to John Cutters in about one year and it will be longer than that before we return. Three of us went there on Sunday the 18th for the steak special. We got there about 3:30 and it was about half full. The service was quick and friendly, but the food - Ug. All three of us ordered the bone in Rib Eye, done medium. I used to come here frequently and the steaks were always good. I don't know what grade meat they are buying but all three were full of sinew and gristle. Cutting them was a chore because they were so tough. All three steaks were done to a different level. One was medium, one was medium rare, and one was close to well done. All three of us left almost half of our steaks on the plate rather than fight with them. No comment from the server when picking up the plates. My wife concluded that they may buy a lower quality of meat for the Sunday half price special. $17.50 for a bone in Rib Eye steak is a good deal. But, if you can only eat half then it becomes the equivalent of $35, the normal price! I don't know if this was the new normal at John Cutters, but I'm not going back anytime soon to find out.

X7UjvLtsSEHUWx78j8RZqQ.text: Went here at like 3am with my boyfriend for some food. We had steak nachos, the rib eye steak with the Jc salad and a side of Mac n cheese. I wasn't really into the nachos or the Mac n cheese but my boyfriend liked them. Everything else was amazing. The steak was sooooo juicy and tender. Lenny the bartender was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back.

z-ucGUh5HzWKBeQysk4gmw.text: We ordered the chicken fingers (tenders) and they were  definitely not tender. They were over cooked, hard as a brick and over priced. Couldn't eat them. 14 dollars for 5 tenders and fries were not worth the money. We have eaten here for awhile and some times you get a bad meal. It is a hit and miss when it comes to good food. Won't go back for a spell. Sorry JC

4HcdYi1Rv1bERsXrLv61NQ.text: Yeah... this is an interesting place. It is kind of like Hooters, Summerlin version. The service is friendly, in a valley-girl, blonde, "Oh my god, this is the best ever!" kind of way. It was a little weird, slightly off putting after awhile. However, she did the YMCA, so I guess I'll give her points for that.  As far as the food, it was alright. Nothing spectacular. The Asian Inspired (deep fried) spring rolls were pretty spicy, but tasted ok. My friend's nachos had a long, blonde hair in it. Gross. It was replaced. The wings were pretty salty. The chicken flatbread- not bad. So, like the service, food is hit or miss.  However, I hear the Sunday steak specials are good- half off all steaks! So, while I'm in no hurry to return, I guess I wouldn't purposefully avoid it, either.

P8NlB3QdJ55UZ8N9WWPcrA.text: Gross place.   Disgusting servers who have no business serving food or drinks. Don't wash their hands, dirty silverware, bussing tables with towels that fall on the ground. Gross gross gross. Food is mediocre but can't hold a candle to the new, nearby restaurants in Downtown Summerlin.  Management clearly doesn't care to staff the place with professionals who care about customer service and health codes....instead they staff with people with no business handling food, drinks, or customers...and who drink on the job.   Classy. Not.

2E067VwG08eQUsltwTJl2w.text: First time here and I walked and noticed that the place was packed, every table was taken. It was 19 dollar surf and turf. Great price for great food it was incredible. I also had the Philly cheese steak and that was amazing also. I will definitely be back here again thank you for the good food

cGEu876_uce6k_Arpewwsw.text: Best place for steaks bar none. Every Sunday all steak 1/2 off. Great place to watch some football while you eat. I'm not a salad kind of guy but this place make great salads too. Everything on the menus are great!

jB2NEJo2e7N-M81Wl-GnmQ.text: Two stars only as the kitchen did a fantastic job on the food (Philly Cheesesteak, Fries, Salad and Chicken Fingers) and the dark haired Bartendress is simply one of the best in Summerlin bar none - attentive, killer cocktails and holds the bar solid. Only two stars as the service was not good, inattentive and dragged. Server called me (50 year old female) "hon" and "babe" - gag, I can survive her lack of decorum, no biggie. She also sat at the table to take order. Really crappy part, this is the second time I've been shorted on change when paying my check. Same waitress, not cool at all. I owned a successful restaurant/bar for 7 1/2 years, I know the business enough. When you pay run over your check in DETAIL, if paying in cash recount your change. My last visit a $20 for a 5.50 additional tab was returned as $6.00 change - shorted $8.50. When mentioned she brought back $14 so still shorted .50 - whatever, we left. Comfy neighborhood bar, great bartender, decent kitchen, cool location - owners seriously needs to tighten up service, get a handle on the money situation.

9CRzUFnRri92YbYw5QaUoQ.text: Food is really good they have half off steaks on Sundays and other specials during the week  Service could be better  They always seem to be short staffed  5 stars on food 3 stars overall  The machines. Don't pay out that often either

HE8zXx3LQo7WJScmmfs16Q.text: Food is good, that's why I leave two stars. Service, just like everyone says, is terrible. Forgot to put in our appetizer, messed up on my burger order(simple as it was) watched our beers sit on the bar for a good 15 minutes before someone brought them, then watched the queso dip sit in the window for forever, oh... And my burger... After I already sent it back for being wrong, also sat in the window for a while before being brought to me. Don't come here if you expect things to be done in a reasonably timely matter. Oy.

GzyWdwhlK-5WmCnF-CKkKA.text: Service is always HORRIBLE. They are consistently understaffed and the few waitresses they have seem to be absolutely incompetent. There is a horrible smell inside the restaurant every time I have been- like there is a broken sewage pipe!?. The absolutely ONLY redeeming quality this place has is the location. JOHN CUTTER OWNERS/INVESTORS: Where are you?! GET THIS PLACE TOGETHER BEFORE YOU GO OUT OF BUSINESS!!! How many poor reviews and negative feedback do you need before you take action and make improvements?

0PAEzuI_BvJAqrGRn4ZNWg.text: The food here is awesome... Great Steaks (1/2 off on Sunday is the best thing going on in Summerlin) and the salads are fantastic too.   However ... the front staff is not the greatest when it comes to service.  I pop in at least twice a week because the food is so good and it's conveniently close to home but the staff can't seem to remember my name or even want to take the time to learn it.   Good food.. no doubt that's what keeps us coming back.  As always... show up for the 1/2 price Steak Sunday ... my friend and I pretty much eat out daily all across the local places in Las Vegas so we know what we are talking about when it comes to local Vegas eats.  Our last trip around we were not drinking too much... switch to water and Iced Tea which pretty much went empty as the waitress was too busy doing who knows what.   We eat and before we are even done with our steaks, the waitress brings us our bill. No mention of desserts or coffee even offered. Seems as if she was more interested in closing out our bill and having us hit the road then stick around...  Luckily Dunkin Donuts is right next door...   The last three experiences have been somewhat similar. I could certainly understand the attitude if we did not tip so well.... but we generally always tip well above 20% on every outing.  One last shot next "Steak" Sunday and if the service is the same... it may be time to look for other places where the front staff does appreciate us. That's what being local is really all about.   Sometimes.... it's just the little things that matter even if you do have a great thing going on.

bj4FreDE3L3BdEElrZBv2w.text: After reading many of the reviews, I certainly feel validated.  I have visited JC a few times - usually when taking my mom out to breakfast or lunch. We originally tried it because they are owned/operated by the same company as Sedona - and my mom is a local.    The last time was just plainly ridiculous. JOHN Cutter has an identity problem.  It is a neighborhood bar/restaurant that wants to be a HOOTERS.   Most of the food is ok (good french toast).   It is the service and atmosphere where John Cutter fails. The bar is too dark and the music is too loud for breakfast or lunch.  To see a family with a bunch of kids or a group of lady golfers come in and then be served by empty headed young women with their breasts literally falling out of their shirts is just embarrassing.   The worst part is that either management has not defined customer service parameters - or worse, they know what is going on and are ok with it. Fail.  I think that Bill W. is correct.  It is a drag because the area could use an actual neighborhood bar/restaurant with good food and suited for everyone. I have no reason to return.

QP1to267GrkL7APMir3_-Q.text: This is a fantastic neighborhood establishment with very friendly staff and delicious ribs (on Friday night only).  The burgers and cheese steaks are not to be missed either, and the flatbread pizza is always a hit.

0j2F-SBcKxCR7kxoJoPYjA.text: My wife and I were brought to John Cutter by my daughter and son in law.   I went to order off the Happy Hour Menu and was told the happy hour was over.  I pointed to my watch that showed that there was 12 minutes before 6 PM.  She then asked if my wife and son in law wanted to change there wine order to the happy hour wine order and price of $5. It was the same wine.  After ordering dinner and waiting, salads were brought to the table. The waitress was different that brought the salads and put the salads in front of my daughter and her husband.  My son in law put on the side serving of salad dressing onto the salad in front of him. He began eating the salad and had several fork loads of the salad when our waitress came over and said the salad my son in law was eating was actually  mine. She picked up the salad and put it in front of me. She then picked up the salad in front of my daughter and moved it to her husband. My kids go here and know the owner so they did not want to say anything. I am the guest but service such as this is not good.  The waitress normal  customer service would be to offer to replace  the salad before just placing it in front of me.  Again my kids did not want to raise a stink so they tried to make light of the mistake. Poor service that is being paid for should be resolved.  The restaurant has two flat screen tv's over the bar. I was watching the college World Series game on one tv when the LA Angels came on the other. The college game was replaced by the World Cup soccer game. Then the Angels game was also replaced by the same world soccer game , now on both. My daughter asked the Angels game be turned back on . The manager sent a message via our waitress that both tv's will show the soccer game. Again customer service is the issue.   I then spoke to the manager. She said she was sorry.  What a frustrating dinner.   Dr. Ken

p2svGmxRY4TVwWbMlEu9JQ.text: I brought my friend from IL and was going to use my groupon but the waitress said it's only good for Sat and Sun and I was so disappointed. I split a BBQ ribs with my friend. I have to say that it was the worst BBQ ribs we've eaten. The only good thing about it is the sauce. BBQ is too dry and hard it was awful to eat. It looks like it was already pre made and recooked.  Go to Lucille's instead. There was only one waitress and kept us waiting. I'll never go back to this place.  Returned groupon.

M84UMj7nSHkGgegEiqgsQg.text: I have to admit. I have not had service this bad in a long time !! Bartender / manager was completely spaced out, did nothing for the 2 hours I was there waiting for my food!  Waitresses where nice but completely incompetent!! Watched the cooks do nothing but argue in the kitchen. I can say I will never go back and not recommend this place to any one. The menu is a absolute mess.  Who ever runs this has no idea what to do in the food  business!!  The only reason it has business is because of lack of competition !!

mfv62aL58n4NA6q8CisLFQ.text: Cutters is nice, but spendy.  The food is good, not great.  Good beer selection.  If the damn place weren't so expensive, I would come here all the time with friends after climbing, as it is very close to my house - could ride my bike there! Unfortunately, it is a bit spendy for me to become a 'regular' there.

bln_fM0VONW-vEiTk0ts1g.text: 'went here Friday night, invited by my rich Red Rock friends who had just discovered it recently- everything was excellent.  I ordered the lobster tails- tender and sweet and just right-  the ribs were the same- the salad was substantial and fresh, with great tasting tomatoes.  My friend let me try her steak salad- delicious- the presentation was also nice for "bar food". I drank Pinot Grigio, since that was what my hosts were drinking and the service was really attentive.  My son let me taste his Chile Relleno, and it was really good.  He was not impressed with the food, but I think I trrump him as I consider myself an experienced Foodie with LOTS of eating in many places in Las Vegas over many years!

ClVUM_SBxso-TB9SW2myLg.text: Worst service. Could not get waited on left after 15 minutes when they sat a couple at the table next to us and they were waited on instantly.

VyXT6s_WXaznm7yzgpHtHQ.text: Had lunch today at John Cutter which I would classify it as upscale bar food. Had the bone in rib eye, house salad, and the Philly fries. The food overall is excellent for bar food in addition to having a reasonable price point. My sister and I shared the entire meal and the cost was less than $30 which was a bargain. On Sundays, all steaks are half off. The wait staff was very attentive and the ambiance was very relaxed. I really like the Philly fries which was very unique. The dish was a plate of french fries that is covered with cheese sauce, mushrooms, onions and shaved steak which was really good. Overall, if you want a great steak at reasonable prices, you really can't go wrong with John Cutter

OlWZJvNCBrppuwV7Twqm1g.text: We have been looking for new restaurants near our home and a friend recommended this place. Though it is tucked away in a shopping center it is definitely a place people know about. When we walked in it every table was full. Even then we didn't wait long and the service was great. I ordered a Chinese chicken salad and it was great. Though I probably should of ordered a steak because they are half off on Sundays. We also ordered the nachos that we're great, though lacking on meat. The ambiance is really nice and we will definitely go back.

I3bRSank4sEa5JUGQWOOQA.text: Not great service. The only food I've had there wasn't good either. No real options for vegetarians.

yhU8nxBWx5JE0MCsH4zApQ.text: Great food!  But definately over priced.  I mean nachos for $15?!?!?  They are yummy but not worth the price.  The menu is small but there is a good variety of options. Great atmospere!  But what a SUPER, tiny place.  It is a cool, little neighborhood CHARGER bar. Overall I recommend you at least try it once.

5AGV4_Qp3u-K-n8gCy_QOw.text: I'm so excited we just found this place in our neighborhood.  We had the soft pretzels, steak salad, and the chicken wrap.    All were delicious.   Very friendly staff and they were even willing to change the tv to our game.  Looking forward to making this a regular place for us!

EkGzb7VE7qbAf0zSrb0DKg.text: After my initial review the owner was quick to reply and remedy the situation.  Thanks for you reply Adam

LvD00iT2vUK-ZHKbjf0urw.text: I came here for the Saturday afternoon live music, which was awesome.  The atmosphere was serene.  I didn't order any food.  I had two ranger IPAs which were 5.50 each, pretty standard price.  Service was good, though I wasn't too aware.  I highly recommend patio seating with live music in the summer, anywhere.

ScMfBAVAD-Ley_ORCAxwTg.text: We went here for breakfast. Probably the worst Chicken Fried Steak ever!! The gravy was gross looking, need a steak knife to cut it, the potatoes were ok, eggs were the best part of this meal. Husband had the JC omelette, over cooked. Daughter had the crispy French toast, ok. The toast we received not toasted, sent back, received the same. SHOULD NOT SERVE BREAKFAST IF IT WILL NOT BE GOOD. I could make breakfast at home and save myself $45.00. Disappointing.

-MpQ6FnoNflWNVg1ET7A_g.text: I really like it at john cutters. I've had the tbone and the filet mignon. The steaks are always cooked perfectly. The JC salad has mixed greens, vinigarette, feta and pine nuts. The fries are fresh. I order the BBQ sauce for dipping even though the fries have such good flavor already. I also really like the chocolate cake. The atmosphere is a little loud and a little dark but overall I will keep eating here.

9EQfWUjreUUIiPRuoInSgg.text: We have been dining at JC's for many years for both breakfast and dinner. For breakfast last Saturday we encounter the worst service. You can definately see lack of training between servers & there knowledge for food, reflecting the management, server couldn't remember a simpl drink order of 2 iced teas and one cranberry. Its been so many times we got served wrong food to our table in previos several visits, poor service. We watched our food sit in the window when we were the only patrons there. Once our food was delievered the server did not provide the adequate amount of roll ups nor plates (there were only 3 of us). Then the server disappeared and we had to pay our bill with the bartender of whom was on a personal call. Could she have placed them on hold?? We love JC's and will return as we love the food but the service is greatly lacking :(
